[img]https://i.imgur.com/hmkqc0i.png[/img]

You are now Brae Emit. 
Having recently baked a couple batches of cookies, you plan on sending them off to your friends. You've made extra care to ensure that none of the cookies triggert any of their allergies, particularly chocolate and/or peanuts. 
Last thing you want to do is throw one of your friends into anaphylactic shock!

[img]https://i.imgur.com/4jO5Poa.png[/img]

There you go. Now all you have to do is send these packages off with some mushroom rings.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/TVEs8ix.png[/img]

You are now June Egbert. 
You've returned home to the house atop Mt. Phoenix a few hours ago, having had your fill of adventure for the day. 
You've been reading the Animorphs series lately. You had once seen these books at the book fairs in school so long ago, but you never really got around to reading them. Thoren just so happens to have the whole set of the books for some reason. 
You're honestly pretty surprised that the content of them can get so heavy! 
There's something almost resonant about the concept of a group of shape shifting teenagers who have to fight a hidden evil in complete secret. Almost like superheroes, but with slightly less spandex.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/nddylCq.gif[/img]

?????
Where did these cookies come from?

[img]https://i.imgur.com/ADzX3k9.png[/img]

You examine these bags of cookies that magically appeared here. There appears to be a bag with your name on it, next to a bag for Thoren and one for Raine as well. After what you've hearing about today from Morcant, you're not sure if you can trust these cookies. Not to mention, the chance of triggering your peanut allergy.

You figure that Thoren would have the ability to detect peanuts, but where the heck are they? You saw them briefly earlier, but they haven't been back upstairs for a few hours now.

What will you do?

[img]https://i.imgur.com/nYTw0DU.png[/img]

What memo?

[color=#0080ff]FL: metal maybe? It's either glass or metal. Maybe ceramic... it's smooth, and cool, and reflects stuff.[/color]
[color=#a58a40]CS: i have an idea of something the material might be like but if it is like that then it is nearly indestructible without power that i'm not sure if any of us have.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]FL: vibranium?[/color]
[color=#a58a40]CS: just to be clear no one has soul their soul to the dark one and gotten the true power right?[/color]

[color=#a58a40]CS: yellow? i mean with crystal things they can be influenced by trace elements in them so i don't know.
CS: also i guess we could rule out Cuendillar unless you were some kind of channeller or if the Forge drew in the one power. [/color]
[color=#0080ff]FL: yeah I don't think it made a magic material. At least, I'm... pretty sure.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/M5zRPYv.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Show Memolog" close="Hide Memolog"][color=#a58a40]CS: well the material itself isn't actually magic.
CS: it's metal altered into another material.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]FL: are you saying that out of pure randomness, the bombardment of quark gluon plasma somehow made a functional spell circle?
FL: ...how common are spell circles?[/color]
[color=#a58a40]CS: I'm saying that it is possible.
CS: also mostly for argument sake I would akin that process more to alchemy seeing as it isn't making anything from nothing just transmuting already existing stuff into other stuff.
CS: something between magic/psionics and alchemy.
CS: in general or like randomly forming?[/color]
[color=#0080ff]FL: Like, from a perspective of random noise on a pixelated grid, how many configurations would be valid spell circles?[/color]
[color=#a58a40]CS: common enough for there to be plently of stories about it.
CS: think of how many stories and legends have random portals to hell, contacts with devils, people springing out of the ground and the like.
CS: so i would say on  grid of random noise anywhere from 1-2.5%?
CS: i might be over estimating a bit but i can't imagine it being higher.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]FL: ...that is horrifying.[/color]
[color=#a58a40]CS: the only reason you don't see more magic is one missing thing. intent.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]FL: ...yeah, the forge doesn't have any AI.[/color]
[color=#a58a40]CS: while that can be gotten around with certain things random/ wild magic is still a thing
CS: structured magic is just a lot more common.
CS: which wild/ random magic doesn't need intent. [/color]
[color=#0080ff]FL: ...would wild magic make such a deal, though?[/color]
[color=#a58a40]CS: make a deal?
CS: what do you mean?[/color]
[color=#0080ff]FL: ...plus would wild magic even have a soul to sell?[/color]
[color=#a58a40]CS: no. wild magic is just the term for magic that just happens randomly, the 1-2.5%
CS: though there are tales of people who can channel wild magic but that always seems a bit iffy to me.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]FL: but yeah, I think we can probably rule out involvement with the "dark one"... whoever that is.[/color]
[color=#a58a40]CS: yeah... i wasn't thinking they were involved.
CS: i just mean that the "true power" they supply is able to destroy basically everything even things that normally aren't destructible.
CS: besides that is a basic selling your soul to the devil situation.
CS: only as far as i'm aware the stories don't have the dark one as a so so fiddle player.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/wintermission200/lb3-213.png[/img] Heh, cheese wheel... ...wait, what's June in another outfit doing approaching here?
> [url=https://mspfa.com/?s=38989&p=788]June: Talk to Charles[/url]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/d7elH0o.png[/img]

Its probably a little too early to be following that retcon route anyways. 
You wind up walking down the road until you find a rather large building. You really hope they have air conditioning because you are not dressed for the weather! 
At least The Breeze can keep you cool for a little while though.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/4n2PeiW.png[/img]

You enter Gene's Garden.

What will you do?

[img]https://i.imgur.com/DDuIKax.png[/img]

You appear to be in a tavern or bar of some sort. Most of the furniture is made of wood, though there are some notable devices which are not made of wood. There are a number of modern and/or futuristic amenities here. 
You never really got into drinking (never really liked how it affected Rose so you stayed away from the sauce) so you likely won't be ordering any alcoholic beverages any time soon. And this isn't even addressing the elephant in the room, regarding exactly what sort of currency they might require. 

It seems rather quiet here at this time of day, and there is in-fact air-conditioning, so it should be a good place to hang out around here.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/fQ4g75y.png[/img]

There appears to be a number of tables and booths over here.
Wait... is that what you think it is?

[img]https://i.imgur.com/g05wfiZ.png[/img]

They have an alchemiter here! 
You could probably alchemize all sorts of cool shit with whatever unknown amount of grist you might still have! But not antimatter, you're not some kind of mad scientist or something.

You wonder if you should have asked that person in the labcoat about what they were alluding to, but at this point you'd rather stay out of the heat.

This alchemiter appears to have an unfamiliar but quite compact setup to it, with a holopad and an odd cord sticking out of it, and notably no visible buttons to press on the actual device.
 
You might need to ask how to use this thing.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/clxcLF0.png[/img]

You are now this kangaroo mouse consort, currently on shift as the bartender. 
You're lucky to get a cushy job like this, though it can get boring when nobody shows up in the sizzling hours of the day.
It looks like somebody's here though who isn't a regular!

[img]https://i.imgur.com/0Fi9Vc1.png[/img] It appears to be some kinda usb, with an attachment for one of those weird other thingies. You might be able to fit this on your phone?
[color=#a2826d]Bar Mouse: Squeak! Do you need any help with that? Maybe a bite to eat?[/color] [color=#0000ff]June: huh?[/color]

p.c: June: Make a joke comparing the bar mouse to a computer mouse.
p.b:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/PmEVJ08.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#0000ff]June: huh, a mouse. i guess you could help me navigate with your laser pointer precision?[/color]
[color=#a2826d]Bar mouse: Heh, you're funny. I could, maybe.[/color]
[color=#0000ff]June: i've never seen an alchemiter setup quite like this one before. where's the dowel scanner? where's the punch designix? where's the cruxtruder?[/color]
[color=#a2826d]Bar mouse: I think if you asked anyone those questions they'd have no idea what you're talking about, squeak.
Bar mouse: to answer it though, that there is a compact alchemiter. We have it work via phone usb connection so it doesn't get used by just anyone wanting to cause a scene, squeak.[/color]
[color=#0000ff]June: fair enough.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/a2oGGP5.png[/img]

...it fits!

It now wants you to install an apk on your phone. Can't be too bad, right?

[img]https://i.imgur.com/kWp8Ivm.png[/img]

It has a simple, well designed interface. You can both just type codes in, or combine codes depending on the mode. There's even support for NORs and such hidden by an "advanced mode" option! 
There also appears to be a section to recall the codes of previously alchemized and captchalogued items, even far back to the beginning of your SBURBan adventure. 
This might come in handy...

You should have everything you need now for a good old-fashioned alchemy binge.

p.c: June: Combine Current Outfit || Breath Heir Outfit.
p.b:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/KSYfGk8.gif[/img]

Let's see what the alchemiter comes up with on this one!

[img]https://i.imgur.com/nYcw3OD.png[/img]

You get the WINDEARTHY HEIRESS OUTFIT! 

This outfit is an absolute mess of mismatched parts. You might be able to salvage some individually nice looking articles of clothing, but all together, it reminds you of a junk car's crappy repair job.

p.c: June: Type in [CODE REDACTED FOR CAUSAL SPOILERS]
p.b:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/Aib9N6W.png[/img]

You get a POKEMON HEALING MACHINE...?

This feels like it would be more useful in an entirely different situation.

You decide to hold onto it until a later date.

p.c: June: Combine Problem Sleuth Game && Hammer
p.b:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/ax91GqA.gif[/img]

You check it on the holopad and sure enough, its good-old zillyhoo.

p.c: June: Combine Pwrwblem Sleuth Game && Hammer
p.b:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/9tbpLyu.png[/img]

Using the weird mostly forgotten ghost image version of the problem sleuth game that you captchalogued in the metaphorical representation of your home, you manage to make a legendary piece of shit.

...At least you get free artifact grist out of the deal?

p.c: June: Combine Vriska designed outfit with Earthy Outfit
p.b:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/l1sSS4D.png[/img]

You combine two vastly different sources of fashion excellence to create this masterpiece: the FRESH CRACKED EGG OUTFIT. It seems to have everything you ever wanted out of an outfit, including a denim skirt!

p.c: June: Combine Earthy Outfit || PokÃ©mon Healing Machine.
p.b:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/ZCuUfAa.png[/img]

You obtained the AUTUMNAL NURSE JOY ENSEMBLE! You were a little iffy about this combination before alchemizing, but it managed to be quite a pleasant surprise. 

You almost feel like you're getting away with something, having such a cute outfit to yourself.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/DBKyNDX.png[/img]

Heck yeah!

You're not sure how you managed to get the single "boot grist" needed for it, but you're not complaining!

[img]https://i.imgur.com/UGLWErX.png[/img]

Looks like you got a good pull! That should do it for today. 

If you ever feel like alchemizing more things, you can always return here later, probably.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/bkbfoJ1.png[/img]

The sound of a slowly ticking clock fills the center of New Charcherry.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/UfKGwmn.png[/img]
[size=7](panel drawn by ifelse95)[/size]

A tall, red figure manifests upon the square, hands in their pockets.

The workers seem quite wary of this phenomenon. Very few of them even go towards the square.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/M3rXA54.png[/img]
[size=7](panel drawn by ifelse95)[/size]

However, a certain Pissed-off Mailcarrier that's come in from quite a distance has no chill, and walks right up to the red figure.

She asks the figure who they think they are.

He simply replies with "casual time god". Not one much for lengthy explanations, it seems.

The Pissed-off Mailcarrier rolls her eyes, tired of the grand entrances made by divine figures that just make her job harder most of the time. She asks the "casual time god" what his business is here.

He mentions that he's just visiting, stating that his daughter, and a close friend of his from another timeline had been here, and thought about dropping by.

The Pissed-off Mailcarrier complains about the mountain she will have to climb to deliver some letters, particularly the fact that santa claus has yet to obtain a PO box. Apparently her entire sylladex is packed with letters addressed to that clown.

The casual time god agrees, and goes on a diatribe on how santa claus "sits on his ass for all but one dayt a year", claiming it to be blasphamy. 
It is unclear how many layers of irony this red figure is at right now, but it must be at least a few.

The Pissed-off Mailcarrier mentions that Santa Claus came out as nonbinary last year, having been spotted flying the Derspit pride flag during their route last Redistro. 
The presence of Prospit and Derse colors on the flag may have sent some mixed messages to the carapacians who saw it.

She excuses herself to resume her route, and the casual time god tells her to take it easy.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/vr9Hg05.png[/img]

And with that, the Pissed-off Mailcarrier walks off towards Mt. Phoenix.
[img]https://i.imgur.com/rH5xsJC.png[/img]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/UJsKNTq.png[/img]

You are now Charles.

p.c: Charles: Sit and wait near the Autumnal pad
p.b:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/j0T2KDG.png[/img]

You go ahead and do that.
All you see is the transportalizer pad, and the hologram of a lemon.  
A hologram apart of a visual system you set up here a while ago.

Maybe you should go through, honestly you don't know why so far-

p.c: Charles: Check the room for intruders
p.b:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/2IcjW6N.png[/img]

You swore you sensed someone, but the chamber is empty. 
You're the only one here, it seems.

p.c: Charles: Just take the pad to autumnal already.
p.b:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/iJJKHqp.png[/img]

After getting up and putting the chair away, you walk forward onto the pad...

[img]https://i.imgur.com/myuu2WY.png[/img]

...And arrive on Planet Autumnal.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/fM5LPqZ.png[/img]

...you could have sworn somebody else just used the transportalizer.

Maybe you're just being paranoid.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/rKXnZrf.png[/img]

You knock precisely in the middle of the wreath, like a bulls-eye.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/O4rx2Lz.png[/img]

Brae answers the door.

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"]
[color=#d5aa00]Brae: Hello Charles! It's rare for you to visit, what can we help you with?[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: Well, Coleman offered to teach me more about magic... and I guess there is another thing. Is Rise here?[/color]
[color=#d5aa00]Brae: Rise is usually in their room or out in the garden. I'm not certain where Coleman has been today, he might be up in his office.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: Alright, you probably want to cover your ears, then.[/color]
[color=#d5aa00]Brae: ...Wouldn't it be easier to send them a message through the memo?[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: This is more entertaining.[/color][/spoiler]

p.c: Charles: yell really loud for Rise
p.b:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/0tV36pJ.png[/img]
[size=20][color=#0080ff]Charles: RISE GET OFF YOUR LAZY ASS AND GO SPEND SOME TIME WITH YOUR OTHER SIBLING![/color][/size]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/Dk3VUgp.png[/img] All the way across the house, the back door is kicked open.
[size=20][color=#ff0000]Rise: WHO THE FUCK IS CALLING ME A LAZY ASS?![/color][/size]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/Q0B5HQ6.gif[/img]
[size=20][color=#5a00aa]Quinn, The demon trapped in this crystal: ...OH MY GOD CHARLES SHUT UP! SOME PEOPLE ARE TRYING TO TAKE A NAP!![/color][/size]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/7thadjS.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...is that Quinn's Crystal on the table over there?[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: ...Charles, seriously?[/color]
[color=#d5aa00]Brae: Coleman was up late making adjustments to Quinn's manor inside the crystal.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...Rise. Thoren is being Santa, and you reportedly haven't seen them once in person since they got back.[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: ...and?
Rise: If they want to see me, they'll do it when they can. We're both pretty fucking busy and I don't just show up unannounced for no reason. And I'm sure they feel the same way.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: I'll contact them later to see if they're available for dinner or something.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...better than nothing, I guess.[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: If there's nothing else to be discussed, I'll be going back to gardening.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/Shi3ejr.png[/img]

Now usually I'd send these commands to my past self as of the current part in the story being illustrated, but its been an entire year and this command probably wouldn't have fit into things back then.

That being said, I've played like, 20(?) minutes of hiveswap act 1 a while back and got overwhelmed by the verbosity in the context of an adventure game with zillions of things to examine, not to mention couldn't figure out what to do next and refused to look up hints while I was still digesting paragraphs of text. 
I wandered through half-harley manor searching for Lore and Stuff. I found Lore, (as well as Stuff) and it fits about as well as I'd want it to, but at the same time, it feels pretty distant from current affairs. 
So yea, I consider Hiveswap to be canon, but don't expect me to play more of it unless there's an Absolute Important reason to do so.

Now if you excuse me, I've got some bug pokemon to catch and release in relative obscurity.

p.c: Quinn: Be incredibly suspicious of Coleman's generosity.
p.b:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/yxOlIdV.png[/img]

Yeah, you are 200 percent suspicious of the lavish furnishings that your captor has conjured for your prison. Meanwhile, you can still hear the conversation outside.

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#d5aa00]Brae: ...Would you like a mug of hot chocolate, Charles? If you want to sit at the table, I can go check to see if Coleman's up in his office.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...Thank you for the offer, but I'm not a huge hot chocolate fan. It's nice sometimes, but it... isn't really the right temperature. Still too warm outside.
Charles:...but sitting at the table does sound nice, thank you.
[/color][/spoiler]

p.c: Brae: Knock on Coleman's office door
p.b:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/1dmpVrT.png[/img] After going upstairs for a moment, you arrive at the door to your boyfriend's office. A simple knock is all you need.
[color=#d5aa00]Brae: Coleman? Charles is here wanting to talk to you about magic.[/color]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/xvtovaW.png[/img]

After a long while of walking and hiking, the Pissed-off Mail carrier finally reaches the summit of Mt. Phoenix. She takes a moment to catch her breath from walking up the incline.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/SDPKdGu.png[/img]

Having sensed someone arriving, you open the door and check. You see the prospitian with the messenger bag. A familiar face, it seems.

You greet her, and ask about the letters from the children.

The Pissed-off Mailcarrier looks up at you, that rip-off santa, trying to stay civil and holds back her frustration. She confirms the delivery of the letters. 

All 3000 of them.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/Niv3JuE.png[/img]

She then proceeds to flip her messenger bag upside down, making an entire deck of captchalogue cards fall out.

You are pleased about the successful delivery.

The Pissed-off Mailcarrier then proceeds to inform you about the "Casual time god" that she met in New Charcherry on the way here. In case he was some sort of rival.

You are curious about this mysterious figure and state that you will have to investigate later. 
You likely will not have the time and energy to do this, considering your priorities.

You thank her for her invaluable service.

She returns the expected pleasantries, and then immediately mentions that she expects to get the captchalogue cards back by the end of the week.

This is nothing particularly new to you, as this routine has been repeated for a few years now. You are certain that you can process all of the letters by the end of the week.

p.c: Thoren: Captchalogue all of the cards. All of them.
p.b:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/iyruzUQ.gif[/img]

You captchalogue the entire deck and file it away under the folder name "Santa Letters".
 
It takes a moment longer to shuffle the cards into the new folder and index them properly, but your file system modus seems to be handling the workload relatively well.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/MF2kXQm.png[/img]

You are now Coleman, the cryptic but endearing Warlock of Time. You assume the knocking at the door of your study has something to do with the offer you extended to Charles the other day, regarding magic lessons. Hopefully your teachings will lessen their anxieties regarding magic.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/wR4nNsV.png[/img]

You open the door and it is none other than the woman who had infiltrated the closely guarded fortress of your heart.

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#a58a40]Coleman: oh he came over? give me one moment and i'll be right down. 
Coleman: do you want to sit in on the lesson too?[/color]
[color=#d5aa00]Brae: Is it alright for me to be in on it?[/color]
[color=#a58a40]Coleman: i mean you are going to need to know the basics of magic too. i mean Fae magic might be a bit different but the basics are the basics.[/color]
[color=#d5aa00]Brae: You're right, that I should know more about magic. If you're okay with me sitting in on it.[/color]
[color=#a58a40]Coleman: that should be fine, i was planning on asking you to sit in anyway, if you wanted.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/BKwMbgJ.png[/img]

On the way to the stairs, you give Brae a quick kiss. 
She kisses you back as well.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/NZKdtNO.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#a58a40]Coleman: hey Charles i'm so glad you could come over. 
Coleman: I hope you don't mind if Brae also sits in on the magic lesson.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: I don't mind![/color]
[color=#d5aa00]Brae: Coleman, do you want tea or hot chocolate? Charles, would you want a mug of tea?[/color]
[color=#a58a40]Coleman: hot chocolate would be nice.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: I'm... not a huge fan of tea. Sorry.[/color]
[color=#d5aa00]Brae: ...Coffee? Rise prefers coffee, so I have plenty of it.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...Honestly I'd just ask the replicator for some rootbeer.[/color]
[color=#d5aa00]Brae: Rootbeer, sure.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/qyUOKOR.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#a58a40]Coleman: alright i suppose to start i should ask, what do either of you know about magic?[/color]
[color=#d5aa00]Brae: Not a whole lot, honestly. I only barely knew the basics of my aspect powers when I had them.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...I know that there are many, many different kinds of systems of magic, but one thing that I have noticed is that... it seems to come from the soul. 
Charles: Well, perhaps that is an... inaccurate describer. I know that the soul is probably the most vital component in shaping magic, but it... is possible to do magic without a soul. 
Charles: Admittingly, I don't know how that works, nor do I want to get into it, but... magic is used by people to warp reality.
Charles: ...and I get a vague idea that magic wants to be used.
Charles: ...and while magic is connected to the soul, it is not as... intrinsically bound to it, like aspect powers are.
Charles: ...I can use Heart Sight pretty reliably to identify someone with aspect powers, but identifying if someone can use magic is... a bit more tricky.
Charles: ...Honestly with the connection that aspect powers have to the soul, you... might understand why I was as concerned as I was, Brae.
Charles: ...So uh, how many of my assumptions need to be corrected, Coleman?[/color]
[color=#a58a40]Coleman: well none of it is wrong, but none of it is exactly right either.
Coleman: First i suppose should be covering the different versions magic. with they can have different names but in general there are a few major styles.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/95qGWXi.png[/img]

[color=#a58a40]Style one: which is gathering the energy from without and using the gathered energy to make an effect, the effect depending on how the gather energy is mixed together. It can be known as channeling, weaving or many others. 

Style two: Is using inner energy to affect to the outside world, basically pitting your will against the universe often with the aid of some inner source of energy. examples being sorcery or psionics.[/color]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/TfhESY6.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#a58a40]Coleman: The last major style is using items or being given power from an outside source that have power or mixing things together to make items with magic within them to make another thing happen. Alchemy would fall under this third one, or at least in my experience.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...So, I... am guessing that Nature Magic falls under category one?[/color]
[color=#a58a40]Coleman: yes it would. though depending on if you are getting it from a source it could also fall under the third.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...I take it that the Second Category or Style is the one I've most commonly seen?[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/v1uw4xJ.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#d5aa00]Brae: Fae magic may fall under the second category, as we're inherently magical ourselves.[/color]
[color=#a58a40]Coleman: it might be. though the one i usually do is a little bit of a mixture of the different styles depending on the situation.
Coleman: also yes Fae magic would fall under the second type.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...is there any... actual rules to magic, or should I just constantly expect everything, forever?[/color]
[color=#a58a40]Coleman: well of course there are rules. First the energy for any magical event has to come from somewhere, as even magic can't fully get around that. Or at least from my experience it doesn't.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...so at the very least, it obeys entropy. That... wait, that doesn't completely add up... wait no... actually yeah, if your drawing energy from other dimensions, it would just appear as infinite free energy, huh...[/color]
[color=#d5aa00]Brae: With Fae as beings of magic, we would just draw the energy from ourselves.[/color]
[color=#a58a40]Coleman: indeed on both accounts. though arguably someone could say that aspect powers are magic just specialized to one thing.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...Right. I wish I knew what a given person knew what to do with magic, so I could defend against it, but... eh, screw it. I have an idea.[/color][/spoiler]

p.c: Charles: Slam down a relevant book
p.b:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/18ES92D.gif[/img]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: Okay, how many spells from this can magic actually pull off?[/color]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/NOgCdSh.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#a58a40]Coleman: i'm not familiar with fourth edition. i know more about 5th and pathfinder.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: Okay, I don't have those two books, but I imagine that most of the spells are the same... right?[/color]
[color=#a58a40]Coleman: i don't know. that is a great Segway into the next part. how spells work.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...okay it's not 4e but... Antimagic Field has me... pondering it.[/color]
[color=#a58a40]Coleman: while it is possible to cut off an area from surrounding magic/ making it where it is harder or near impossible to cast spell by making a circle with the intent to prevent magic.
Coleman: however before anything more major like that you should likely start with the basics Charles.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: I was only wondering if it was possible, not for if a novice could do it.
Charles: ...because when you remove all the insanity from the words... that sounds exactly like what the machine that the entity possessing me was trying to make. Like, an artifact of sorts.[/color]
[color=#a58a40]Coleman: that is possible to do, to make items infused with spells though it takes a fair amount of study and effort to make a things like that.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...so, are we going to start with... making a tiny light hover in front of us?[/color]
[color=#a58a40]Coleman: i mean sure if you want. the important parts to begin with are focusing and creativity.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/cRQHEbg.gif[/img]

You focus intently on the bottle of rootbeer in front of you.

There is nothing but that bottle.

Just the bottle...

[img]https://i.imgur.com/RUGMcIP.gif[/img]

Was that fire??
[img]https://i.imgur.com/K0fFCiE.gif[/img]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/gcrKUWL.gif[/img] It is a smashing success.
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...whoops.[/color]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/2Io27fP.gif[/img]

Before Brae can even get out of her seat, you quickly get to work with cleaning up your mess.

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#a58a40]Coleman: that was fairly well done Charles.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...I'm pretty sure that was just heart powers, manifesting as fire. 
Charles: I was trying to levitate it.[/color][/spoiler]

p.c: FL: Put glass into the "Deadly Shrapnal" sylladex folder.
p.b:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/8xRN8GN.png[/img]

Nothing to see here.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/o20tJxI.png[/img]

Rise steps inside again, thankfully less pissed off than last time.

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#ff0000]Rise: What's going on here?[/color]
[color=#d5aa00]Brae: Magic lessons.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...I mean, it's either that, or I make explosions when I try to cast magic.[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: Somehow I'm not surprised.
Rise: anyways, I invited Thoren over for dinner. They wanna bring Raine and June over too. I plan on cooking.[/color]
[color=#a58a40]Coleman: i mean starting out it can be harder to get the magic to do exactly what you want. so it could have been either.[/color]
[color=#d5aa00]Brae: That sounds lovely, and like fun![/color]
[/spoiler]

p.c: FL: Glance at the replicator over there
p.b:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/CYXQK2j.png[/img] You glance and take a double-take. Have you been relying on food replication for so long that you've forgotten what good food tastes like?
[color=#ff0000]Rise: Alright, I'll let them know. I still need to figure out what to cook though.[/color]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/nPjWxqd.gif[/img]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...I'll get going. Before Raine shows up. Right. SEEYA![/color]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/FqsUxO8.png[/img]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: I suppose he had other plans? Rise: Anyhow, I still need to choose a dish to cook, and I can't think of jack shit.[/color]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/aSS2OIc.png[/img]

You are now Thoren, and it has been quite a day for you. You have spent most of it answering letters addressed to Santa Claus. And to think that you thought that the weeks of backlogged love letters would be a lot! This mountain of letters makes those look like a single haiku scrawled in pen on a cocktail napkin!
At this point, you're 23% done with the current stack of letters, but there's no denying that it is tiring work. June even volunteered to help you with this task!

Just hours prior, you received a confirmation message from you sibling, Rise, regarding the invitation to Brae's house for dinner tonight. It is confirmed that you may bring Raine and June along with you, as they had expressed interest in showing up as well.

With your plans figured out, you put on your stylish suit to look your best. The others should also be ready soon.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/AcnxUbZ.png[/img]

You are now June. Thoren has informed you about a dinner invitation, and more recently, a confirmation on them allowing both you and their wife to show up to their sister's house. 
You're rather eager to finally meet her in person, especially considering how much she has given you in the short time you have been a guest here.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/0WlWtHQ.png[/img]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/PCnTibk.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Show Long Exposition" close="Hide Long Exposition"]A few months ago, when the group had met up with Brae again, it had been revealed that she was originally a time player who was forcibly turned into a space player, thanks to the meddling instigated by Chronos, the timespace doubletier who had forcefully initiated the SBARGv2 session. 

He had desired for the Emit children to fulfil his wishes and carry on his egotistical desires beyond his lifetime. This was of course foiled. 

In Brae's case, she had lived for many years after the game session in seclusion because the alteration of her aspect had made her unstable, causing her to drip a mysterious thick black liquid, sometimes as thick as tar. 
Sometimes she would even lose the ability to properly collide with solid objects. It was assumed that if it were to continue, she would eventually fall apart completely.

It was only after being kidnapped by the Queen Titania, rescued by Coleman, and then given The Choice by Queen Mab to be remade as one of the fae (at the cost of her humanity, and any sburban abilities she may have had), that Brae was able to be free of such a worrying fate.[/spoiler]

[color=#c20000]Thoren: ...[/color]

[color=#0000ff]June: ...is there something i'm missing here?[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: It's... a long story.[/color]

Brae: I'm happy with what I've been able to do since then.[/color]

Talk regarding the darkness that had consumed your heart has made eating difficult. You opt to excuse yourself from the table. Thankfully, it appears most of the table has already finished eating.

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#c20000]Thoren: ...I'd like to go home now. You have all been gracious to host us here, and I appreciate that.[/color]

[color=#d5aa00]Brae: We should meet up again soon and spend time together, if you'd like. I'd certainly like to talk with you more.[/color]
[color=#c20000]Thoren: On another day, yes. We do have much to catch up upon.[/color]
[color=#5a00ff]Raine: Let's go home.[/color]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/PwTzI7x.png[/img]
[color=#0000ff]June: thanks for having us. seeya next time?[/color] [color=#a58a40]Coleman: yes i suppose that is likely. have a nice evening.[/color]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/NaSJ7On.png[/img]

You are now Rise Emit. 
Out of curtesy you decide to also do the dishes. Things could have went differently tonight, but then again, there's a lot of things that could have gone differently in the past. 
So many twists and turns of history that make up the weave of the tapestry of your life...
And yet your thread is the only one with true continuation in this personal blanket of possibilities.

But what if... what if that could be changed? what if another set of possibilities could be given priority? 
Would it be worth it?

Who knows...

[spoiler open="Show Newsletter Text" close="Hide Newsletter Text"]lavendersiren posted at [ 1:53am ] on [ 12/12/20 ], from [ Desertia Hotel ]
TOPIC: Charcherry Weekly - Issue 20

[u]Charcherry Weekly[/u]

Hello, Mage of Light Nick Card here! Another quiet week, but at least p decent.

[u]Progress with New Charcherry[/u]

Heir of Time Thoren Emit has been negotiating with the Jinglorian Construction Union to decide an arrangement that would be beneficial to both parties in regards to the building of New Charcherry. Reportedly, it has been decided that the Union will proceed to build at their usual pace, while specific holiday festivities spearheaded by Thoren will largely involve temporary structures such as tents and removable items. Both parties apparently are supportive of this arrangement.
The completion of construction will likely occur at some point in 2021.

[u]Cookies![/u]

Brae Emit of Autumnal has apparently managed to conquer the legalese-esque limitations of her ability to give food to others as a fae, and in celebration sent baggies of cookies to everyone she knows. Thankfully there were minimal potential allergens present, though Heir of Breath June Egbert reportedly called upon Heir of Time Thoren Emit to scan her cookies for traces of peanuts. There were no traces of peanuts.
The cookies turned out great and I wish Brae the best of luck with her future cooking endeavors!

[u]Wheel Breaker Challenge[/u]

Rogue of Heart Charles has thankfully been somewhat tame as of late. With the usage of his forge on Desertia, a peculiar, yellow, glasslike by-product was reportedly formed along its edges. It had been removed, but has yet to be broken by any known force. Charles has rolled the material into a hoop shape, and has taken it to right outside the lab with a challenge to any who may hope to leave their mark upon it.

Anyone who succeeds in breaking this material first shall get a prize of a very large blue cookie, presumably with proof of the feat shown to Charles. So far, minimal attempts have been made with minimal results. It is not water soluble.

The holidays are getting closer and closer! There's been talk about a Secret Santa, but there's been a lack of organization so I'm just sorta waiting for things to get put together on the back-end on that. Comment below![/spoiler]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/HoIBdFw.png[/img]

That Guy... the timespace menace, the doubletiered virus, the common enemy... all of which are names used to describe this figure. To most, he was known as Chronos.
To you, he was your mentor, and the one that would ultimately betray you. 

He had taken you in, in your most hopeless of days in the SBARGv2 session. You had no friends, and so the vile fiend was able to shape you into a killing machine, still made of flesh.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/6gInbuc.png[/img]

You were called upon to slaughter so many of the other players that you soon fell into the dark point of even wishing to end your own life. Chronos used that as a way to get you to willingly ascend to god tier as the Heir of Time, soon calling upon you for one last mission afterwards.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/ke4ZxCX.png[/img]

Both blessed and cursed with divine power, you (and a maid of life) took the trip to Chronos's lair for further instruction. 
You would be tasked with escaping your damned session, having been doomed by the loss of too many key players (by your blade, nonetheless).

[img]https://i.imgur.com/fAr2odb.png[/img]

Your escape with the maid (and a spider consort) would prove to be a harrowing experience, with many attempts in many doomed timelines, due to the sheer severity of [color=#0000ff]The Blue Hole of Death[/color]-- your session's own ticking time bomb.

The [color=#0000ff]Blue Hole[/color] is said to have been a manifestation of Chronos's inability to assemble the game code cleanly enough, only rivaled by his error-stricken dumping ground of choice: the Land of Copper and Lasers.
(Coincidentally, that land was the one Katie was given.)

The [color=#0000ff]Blue Hole[/color] was a bugbear so powerful that not even godtier revival could save one unlucky enough to fall into it. It has been rumored that one could potentially be removed from all history if consumed by the [color=#0000ff]Blue Hole[/color]. 
This claim is still unverified, but it is certain that the [color=#0000ff]Blue Hole[/color] was extremely deadly, and in nearly every doomed timeline, it wound up consuming the entire incipisphere. 

Upon escaping, you found yourself on an endlessly long journey across the furthest ring that not even the maid could handle before disappearing into the abyss, leaving you alone once more.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/j2FrVLz.png[/img]

After literal years of hellish travel through the void, you finally arrived in the SBRIGHT session.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/3tnAwED.png[/img]

Following your instincts, and what you can only guess was the voice of your mentor, you dominated this session, clearing out all of its challenges singlehandedly while the six players were left with minimal to achieve on their own. 

You hobbled their chances at gaining further power in favor of your own lust for conquest. 
You killed the kid who taught you how to code in ~ATH. 
You forced the girl you had a slight crush on to fight her denizen for the wrong reasons, leaving her without that denizen's guidance. 
You even sequentially choreographed a simultaneous assassination of everyone's dreamselves using your time powers for an outwardly instant slaughter. 

You were practically unstoppable.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/0o3tr96.png[/img]

And when you arrived at the endgame door, you lashed out at the survivors, fearing the end of your adventure. You had been convinced that claiming the Ultimate Reward would paradoxically strip you of all that you had accumulated in this ruthless campaign.

You were the only survivor left on the platform, not even the door itself escaping your wrath.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/UMoH6lS.png[/img]

At this point, you had lost any sense of shame for your actions, only thirsting for more power. 

Whether it was your journey within eternal earshot of the horrorterrors, or the nagging voice that pushed you onwards during this session, or perhaps just plain losing faith in anyone beyond yourself to provide anything that you felt that you needed... You had changed. 
You were no longer able to claim innocence. 

You had slain those elves of your own twisted volition.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/dgC2CpM.png[/img]

And what did you do after you revoked the ultimate reward from your co-players? You sought another session to pillage for it's treasures! 
Your fate was sealed the moment you took the bait from the corrupted first guardian that sent you that game disk to enter the next iteration with.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/gQVwWVJ.png[/img]

You were given a download of the client program for the very first version of SBARG, and upon entering with the space player's house, you arrived at your long-sought-after destiny.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/Bk1dTWi.png[/img]

Time's influence drew around you, not unlike a noose around your neck. 
You had become perfectly primed for your true purpose...

[img]https://i.imgur.com/eIArbPS.png[/img]

...To become the host of the timespace monster that would ultimately consume you.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/C4XiaPZ.png[/img]

Your life was ended that day, and you never came back. Your own ambition and lust for power was your downfall, and the evil lurking beneath the surface made you pay the ultimate price.
It was no surprise that your death was judged as Just.

At that point was when the soul and the body parted ways, never to reunite in the same way ever again. You were not present to witness the violent resurrection of your corpse, reborn in a fire that attempted to cremate you.

From the depths of Prospit, the seemingly impossible occurred: a double ascension, stacking Space on top of Time. A sinister virus-- one that had lurked within your body since the day you signed the contract with your mentor using your own blood-- was activated in this moment, and triggered a dark metamorphosis. This amplified the power you had accumulated and made various unknown changes, in the hope that whatever emerged would be a living weapon, with the capability to slaughter a horrorterror.

The one who did emerge from your corpse had everything you had earned, but in the process, had lost their soul. While you had descended to the underworld, distraught by your sudden fall from glory, Chronos paraded about across time and space in your body, still thirsting for the power you once craved.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/E3kTDAl.png[/img]

You still blame yourself for this, and all of the foul deeds that he had caused over the countless years. 

If it were not for you, he would not have used his destructive abilities to lay waste to what seemed like thousands of player lands, killing countless players and consorts alike.

If it were not for you, he would not have control over both time and space, essentially making him able to do anything he wanted, with only the desire to further his own gains through continued conquest.

If it were not for you, he would not have evaded the reset device designed to wipe the session from all existence. 
One cannot outrun a sufficiently determined time player, after all.

And if it were not for you, Chronos would not have found the limits of his power, and seek to build his selfish legacy with whatever dwindling time he had left.

It was by your hand that this cruel circle was shaped, and you blame yourself for everything.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/NYqHK75.png[/img]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/cYXlT2V.png[/img]

After a brief trip to the Warp Zone, you arrive in Charcherry. It is snowing.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/FD5qUYk.gif[/img]
[size=7][url=https://www.deviantart.com/sarinilli/art/Skyward-Sword-Ancient-Hylian-Font-277220924?offset=0]Skyward sword ancient hylian font by Sarinilli[/url][/size]

You summon the Gravity Suit from a place unknown as it forms around you. 
You are briefly aware of text in an ancient script you do not understand, but pay it no mind. 

As long as this piece of mysterious technology keeps you warm and safe, it doesn't matter what else it might be able to do.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/Anlacgt.png[/img]

You set off on your journey to the top of the mountain.
[img]https://i.imgur.com/vLoehE0.png[/img]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/0JCCBVU.png[/img]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/zgZv4KM.gif[/img]

After a quiet walk up the mountain trail, you arrive at the front door.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/vTtRrpM.png[/img]

You knock on the door. Somebody hears you.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/fdpUesN.png[/img]
[color=#0000ff]June: ...whoa! are you... June: is that suit legit? [/color]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/6QWXUOx.png[/img]
[color=#0000ff]June: are you metroid?[/color]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/2g7G9P9.png[/img]

You stand there for a moment, slightly baffled.
Then you realize you're still wearing the gravity suit.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/Cn8Kc9x.png[/img]

You unfocus enough to disengage the suit.

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#5bd285]Mei: Oh, uhm... I'm Mei.[/color]
[color=#0000ff]June: oh, nice to meet you. my name's june.[/color]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: Nice to meet you too, June! Uhm... I'm here because I heard that Thoren had crashed, and I wanted to make sure they were okay.[/color]
[color=#0000ff]June: ...crashed? i haven't heard any word of that happening. i think you can probably come in though.[/color]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: It was noted on the memo... something about Zalgo text... Also, thank you.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/ZmdnHSD.png[/img] You enter the living room. You realize you've never been inside of Thoren's house before.
[color=#0000ff]June: zalgo text... never heard of it. i'm guessing it was lode-bearing?[/color] [color=#5bd285]Mei: I suppose so.[/color]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/5uxAnBV.png[/img]

You decide to search upstairs. There appears to be an open door up ahead.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/HFBPQqF.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#5bd285]Mei: Thoren...?[/color]
[color=#5a00ff]Raine: ...When did you get here?[/color]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: Uhm, June let me in... I had come along to check on Thoren, as the memo had indicated that they crashed... and I was worried.[/color]
[color=#5a00ff]Raine: Oh, okay. I've heard Thoren say good things about you so you're off the hook.[/color]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: O-oh... I haven't even introduced myself but...
Mei: May I come in?[/color]
[color=#5a00ff]Raine: Might as well. It's taking longer than usual for them to reboot, it looks like.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/4UyaDy2.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#5bd285]Mei: Has this happened before..?[/color]
[color=#5a00ff]Raine: Well it wouldn't be the first time they've crashed. 
Raine: They tend to do this when overwhelmed. 
Raine: I can only guess that the workload has something to do with it.[/color]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: Yeah, probably... although I was wondering if it ever took this long to reboot before?[/color]
[color=#5a00ff]Raine: beats me. It's one of the longer episodes at least.[/color]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: ...Any way to reset them?[/color]
[color=#5a00ff]Raine: I dunno, I'm not a computer expert.[/color]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: I guess we do have to wait it out, then.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/IPEPR1S.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#5a00ff]Raine: ...I got an idea but its kinda cheesy and might bend a personal boundary.[/color]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: ...Well, it's worth explaining, I suppose.[/color]
[color=#5a00ff]Raine: I'm thinking of giving them a kiss. Only issue is they don't have a way to say no while like this.[/color]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: ...Hm... well, I guess it really depends on how your boundaries for each other are set up? I don't really know, this is... hm...[/color]
[color=#5a00ff]Raine: We usually ask before most things out of courtesy. They usually say yes to most reasonable things though. We both have our own baggage so its nice to know these things.[/color]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: Understandable. Although... I'm not sure if I can really give my input on this matter... or even should.[/color]
[color=#5a00ff]Raine: yeah fair.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/qJn7Vo6.png[/img]

You are now Thoren and you are busy as all fuck trying to get your robotic body back into an operable state.

[color=#c20000]'I really don't need to hear your narration right now.'[/color]

Well hey, gotta let the audience know that you aren't just stuck like that.

[color=#c20000]'The audience doesn't need to know jack shit.'[/color]

The audience needs to know the details that will make your story make sense and be compelling to read about.

[color=#c20000]'Look, I'm really fucking stressed right now. I've been sorting through letters all fucking day long with barely any breaks, to the point that the tiniest piece of misplaced unicode bullshit was enough to crash the operating system. Do you THINK I have the time to deal with your meta crap?'[/color]

You have as much time as I let you have. And besides, you're the one who forgot to take a break. You did most of that work off-screen.

[color=#c20000]'...fuck you.'
'I wouldn't be surprised if you were the reason why I had another episode of traumatic flashbacks the other day.'[/color]

You can't blame everything on the author. Besides, from my point of view, most of this stuff has already happened. Any gaps in my knowledge are filled with guesstimates.

[color=#c20000]'Then tell me, future fuck, when does this piece of shit chunk of metal wind up rebooting properly?'[/color]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/kZPzCng.png[/img]

Right about... now.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/zqh7cst.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#c20000]Thoren: ...[/color]
[color=#5a00ff]Raine: baby, are you okay?[/color]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: Hey there... you alright?[/color]
[color=#c20000]Thoren: damn... that was one hell of a memory dump to sort through...
Thoren: Mei? Raine?[/color]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: Hello.[/color]
[color=#5a00ff]Raine: I'm so glad to see you okay. Are you in a mood for hugs?[/color]
[color=#c20000]Thoren: I could use one right now, yeah.[/color][/spoiler]

p.c: Hazel: Try to figure out how the fuck Thorenbot crashed
p.b:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/G0AeCYV.png[/img]

Unfortunately, you are too busy reacting to a SUDDEN GUNSHOT, which seems to have triggered your SPIRIT OF THE HUNT. 

You cannot focus on such technical things at this time.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/3uzIh05.png[/img]

You are now Mei. 
You have been keeping Thoren company for the past half hour alongside their wife. It was a nice and peaceful moment together.

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#5bd285]Mei: Hey, I'm so glad we got to talk for a little bit... but it's getting late, and I believe I have work tomorrow... 
Mei: Oh! I don't think I told you but, I got a new job.[/color]
[color=#c20000]Thoren: Ah, you did? Is it a good one?[/color]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: I think so, much better than my old one. I'm Katie's secretary now, pretty much.[/color]
[color=#c20000]Thoren: That sounds like a fine occupation to hold. I wish you the best in your work.[/color]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: Thank you. I wish you the same.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/XO2mNN0.png[/img]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: Anyways... let's hang out again sometime soon! Hopefully for a little longer.[/color] [color=#c20000]Thoren: Alright. Perhaps another day. Farewell Mei.[/color] [color=#5a00ff]Raine: Seeya next time.[/color]
Meanwhile on the memo... [color=#ad6625]AC: searching for magicant gives a bunch of "magic" results AC: so the search function is unreliable.[/color] [color=#ff0000]PK: It's an unfinished glitchy area coded into SBARGv2, which seems to have spread into Gene.[/color]
[spoiler open="Show Long Exposition" close="Hide Long Exposition"]Okay, as somebody who has done some studying on this place, with some consulting with my sibling, its a bit different from the skaian magicant that those familiar with sbargv2 and the sburb glitch faq have come to know about. First of all, the Geneian magicant ain't glitchy. It also isn't unfinished. It can be described simply as "The Backrooms of the Gods". This is all while at the same time having the eerie emptiness of a dead mall, complete with skeletons, the abandoned corpses of tower records and k-mart, and all that good stuff. However, it has the similarity with its skaian counterpart in that it can be used as a shortcut between different places within the realm. In this case, anywhere connected to powerful machines of the game in this universe. It can be very useful, but also very very unsettling, hence why most people in this group opt to use the Warp Zone transportalizer network instead. Charles was planning on using that, but a rare sabotaged warp sent them just down the road from the lab instead.[/spoiler]

We went ahead and all did that, though the night before I was writing up a newsletter so it took me a while to start looking for a gift.

p.c: Rise and Thoren: To the Diner!
p.b:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/ljObVqj.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#c20000]Thoren: ...So. We have waited all day for this moment. What is it you wish to discuss?[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: I know this isn't that big of a deal, but I need help figuring out a gift for Mei.[/color]
[color=#c20000]Thoren: For the secret santa?[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: Yeah.
Rise: I figure you would have a better idea, since you know her a little better than me.[/color]
[color=#c20000]Thoren: ð¤ hm... 
Thoren: I feel like Mei would enjoy something small and simple. Being surrounded by the grandeur of our group's divine riches, she may be pining for the comforts of her old home. 
Thoren: Considering her exile status, and the rather large boulder upon the transportalizer pad, there is little chance of her going back to her world. But with your powers over time, you could easily visit during a less suspicious point in time.[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: So, something from Hepi, a couple months ago?[/color]
[color=#c20000]Thoren: That is a possible route. There are other paths, but that one seems to stick out the most as of presently.[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: hm, I'll have to think of something...
Rise: ...wait, dammit, I'll easily get tracked down and she'll know I'm the one assigned to her.
Rise: Have to take a route that won't give the recipient away.[/color]
[color=#c20000]Thoren: Ah, that is true. You are rather serious about the secret of secret santa.[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: Well when you're stuck doing nothing but farming in the background, even the smallest goal feels worth overdoing[/color]
[color=#c20000]Thoren: stuck? you do know you are not trapped on autumnal.[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: it's just... Brae's our sister and I feel like I should be there for her, especially since she was missing for 7 years. 
Rise: Then again she has a boyfriend now and hardly any time to spend with me.
Rise: Sometimes in passing she ruffles my hair, but it feels almost more like a formality than anything at this point.[/color]
[color=#c20000]Thoren: I am intrigued at the concept of you letting anyone touch your hair.[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: I trust my sister not to stab me in the back or reject me.
Rise: As you well know, trust is a precious thing for me.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/SpauFlZ.png[/img]

You suddenly feel the desire to catch on fire. Fortunately, such desires are dulled by thorenbot's firmware, preventing most cases of self harm.
However, you do notice something upon taking inventory of your diagnostics...

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#c20000]Thoren: ...it appears my battery is running low. 
Thoren: We should make haste back home.[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: I'm not sure if you really have recharging to do, but whatever.[/color]
[color=#c20000]Thoren: Such factors should not be trifled with lightly.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/4U4vWGc.png[/img]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: Hey wait up![/color]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/kv2yGTg.png[/img]

Eh.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/NvaCRYA.png[/img]

You arrive in Thoren's basement garage.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/e3U8hif.png[/img]

And with that, the day draws to a close.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/QJee1ST.png[/img]
-- [color=#c20000]eternalFugitive[/color] [[color=#c20000]EF[/color]] has responded to memo -- [color=#c20000]EF: They were not kidding when they named this difficulty setting Very Hard. Perhaps I should have challenged Sephiroth at normal difficulty. EF: My attacks are also not very well suited to launching or dealing consistent damage, it seems.[/color]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/AR193RD.gif[/img]
[color=#c20000]EF: Not to mention I forgot to take off that ridiculous sans undertale outfit.[/color]

p.c: Thoren: Challenge Sephiroth on not Very Hard this time
p.b:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/Un23Xnz.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Show Memolog" close="Hide Memolog"][color=#c20000]EF: I folded and challenged on normal difficulty. It was rather average and I was able to unlock him, but the allure of Very Hard still calls out to me.
EF: I'll challenge him again later. The challenge is still available in the menu.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]FL: thinking of setting up the AU Machine in the living room, but id... kinda like to stick it in a dedicated Arcade building. For some reason.
FL: there is also a lot of data in the buffer that... I kinda wanna go through.
FL: ...bad brain, bad. That is a terrible idea.
FL: to explain for anyone that doesn't have access to my thoughts, I just thought about hooking the AU Machine up to the Stargate.
FL: for the love of gene, we do not need another mew incident.[/color]
[color=#303c69]JM: what[/color]
[color=#0080ff]FL: long story. Not sure if anyone remembers. Tbh there was more than one, but peeps are more likely to remember one than the other.[/color]
[color=#c20000]EF: I have access to a selection of memories that involve a "mew incident". Rise likely remembers better.
EF: I assume that connecting an AU machine with a stargate would allow for AU emulated content to cross over into this world?[/color]
[color=#0080ff]FL: correct. Just like that old door in the og magicant.
FL: ...though knowing what I do now, I am... uncertain if "emulated" is the right word.[/color]
[color=#c20000]EF: hm, curious...[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/m4yJze1.png[/img]

Somebody's cooking up something...

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#c8a8cd]Nick: heya Mei![/color]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: Hey! Did you make all this?[/color]
[color=#c8a8cd]Nick: yep! Felt like doing some cooking for once.
Nick: there's just something satisfying about spending time alone in the kitchen with the promise of homemade food at the end, you know?[/color]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: Oh, definitely!
Mei: This all smells delicious by the way, I could smell it from my room.[/color]
[color=#c8a8cd]Nick: heh... Must have been the onions and garlic.[/color]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: ...Do you mind if I join you at the table here? It's alright if you would like some alone time, though.[/color]
[color=#c8a8cd]Nick: go for it! I appreciate the company at the table.[/color]
[/spoiler]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/RDl7pcx.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#5bd285]Mei: So, how have you been? Excited for the holidays?[/color]
[color=#c8a8cd]Nick: I've been alright, taking it easy mostly. Kinda excited for the holidays but I don't know exactly what kinda plans are going on around here.[/color]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: Understandable. I'm not so sure, either, if I'm going to be honest. But I have a feeling that it will be a good one, either way.[/color]
[color=#c8a8cd]Nick: I sure hope so. Last thing I want is being out of the loop and not being invited to whatever winds up happening.[/color]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: Also understandable.[/color]
[color=#c8a8cd]Nick: ...so, I've finally started that webcomic adaptation of left beef.[/color]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: Oh? a webcomic?[/color]
[color=#c8a8cd]Nick: Yeah. With a mix of fresh drawings, game screenshots, and some 3D work here and there.
Nick: I figure having it in multiple formats will give it more public sticking power as an epilogue.[/color]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: Ooh! That sounds cool!
Mei: Where can I view it? I've already watched Katie play it during our lunchbreak some time ago, but I would love to see it in a different format.[/color]
[color=#c8a8cd]Nick: it's on [alt=(literally right here lol)]mspfa.com[/alt]. just look up my chumhandle and you'll find it.[/color]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: Alrighty. I'll be sure to check it out in a little bit! I left ERII in the other room, otherwise I would take a look now.[/color]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: Well, I should go turn in for the night. I will read your web comic and then go to bed, I think.[/color]
[color=#c8a8cd]Nick: Alright, get some good sleep![/color]
[/spoiler]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/osI2Cr1.png[/img] [size=7][url=https://jadedresearcher.itch.io/dollsim](Eddie's hair is from dollsim)[/url][/size] You are now Eddie. It seems like a nice time of night to get a little fresh ai-
[color=#275abe]Mimi: What'cha doin'?[/color]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/jTmc2Pr.gif[/img]

...It's Mimi, the heir of void who came from the first rpg maker game I ever made. 
I'm not sure how an instance of them ended up appearing in Gene as a player of the game, but I worry about them.

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#275abe]Mimi: oh, sorry to startle you![/color]
[color=#008141]Eddie: ...u-uhm..its ok. Im j-just getting some fresh air[/color]
[color=#275abe]Mimi: ah, got it.
Mimi: plenty of that out here.[/color]
[color=#008141]Eddie: ...y-yeah.[/color]
[color=#275abe]Mimi: they've been doing a lotta construction lately.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/ZQhmHDw.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#008141]Eddie: ..u-uh...who..?[/color]
[color=#275abe]Mimi: Not sure, but it's a lot of folks, that's for sure.[/color]
[color=#008141]Eddie: ..a-alright[/color]
[color=#275abe]Mimi: you okay over there?[/color]
[color=#008141]Eddie: ...y-yup.[/color]
[color=#275abe]Mimi: Alright. Sure you don't need another blanket or something?[/color]
[color=#008141]Eddie: ..y-yeah, why would i-i need another?[/color]
[color=#275abe]Mimi: you almost sound like you're shivering, idk[/color]
[color=#008141]Eddie: s-sorry, im still a bit s-startled[/color]
[color=#275abe]Mimi: huh. I didn't even climb out of the void zipper within view this time.[/color]
[color=#008141]Eddie: ...what[/color]
[color=#275abe]Mimi: oh, the void zipper is what I use to enter subspace. It's a pretty neat place, though usually weirdly quiet. for some reason a lot of plants grow around here in the subspace plane.
Mimi: then again, most of them practically look like sticks in the ground, but whatever.[/color]
[color=#008141]Eddie: ..r-right[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/0omMLoZ.png[/img]
[color=#275abe]Mimi: welp, I got some cacti to dig up. Seeya around?[/color] [color=#008141]Eddie: ...u-uh.. maybe? Eddie: ...o-ow.[/color]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/RCtTQB7.png[/img]
[color=#008141]Eddie: ..b-bye...? Eddie: ...well that was awkward..[/color]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/EVW9Z0G.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#c20000]Thoren: Good morning.[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: hey. Hope you don't mind.[/color]
[color=#c20000]Thoren: we're family, there is no trouble.[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: cool.[/color]
[color=#c20000]Thoren: I do however have a favor to ask of you. Are you willing to complete a short mission?[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: depends. what's the objective?[/color]
[color=#c20000]Thoren: I need you to assist in helping me obtain an alchemiter and a grist grinder device for the factory downstairs.[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: ...lemme have breakfast first.[/color]
[color=#c20000]Thoren: Of course.
Thoren: I would perform this task myself, but I have a great deal of other tasks to complete.
Thoren: According to my calculations, the quickest way to obtain one would be to... alchemize an alchemiter.
Thoren: I would suggest alchemizing the grinder first.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/InIkwF0.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#ff0000]Rise: damn, I'm gonna have to fight a lot of underlings on that DLC land. I'm running pretty low on grist.[/color]
[color=#c20000]Thoren: That is what the grist grinder is for.
Thoren: That way no blood need be shed for the sake of resources.
Thoren: While it does cost boondollars to be used, it should be practically a non-issue, considering conversion rates and post-game riches.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/ZuWGy6Q.png[/img]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: Alright. I need to get back into the swing of things anyways.[/color]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/YuwVH2O.png[/img]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: I'll see you later. Don't overwork yourself.[/color] [color=#c20000]Thoren: I will work as much as necessary. Good luck on your task.[/color] [color=#ff0000]Rise: heh, I don't need luck, I got skill.[/color]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/mfXp5Lb.png[/img]

You fully intend to spend the entire day kicking underling ass on the Land of DownLoadable Content and Challenges. 

You've been itching for an excuse to fight anyways.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/Ls5uOLm.png[/img]

You arrive in New Charcherry. It appears that the festivities are in full swing today. 
None of them will be able to earn you a significant amount of grist however.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/OE9cw8G.png[/img]

You enter the hangar. The sounds of the outside world are muffled and echoed here. Two aged spaceships sit here, unused for a hundred elapsed years. You have no interest in either of them however, you have a much more convenient method of traversing the cosmos at your disposal.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/yw8BtpE.png[/img]

The transportalizer pad leading to the Warp Zone.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/A6AzDZW.png[/img]

You arrive at the warp zone. You know exactly where you need to go next.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/2Fsi0VY.png[/img]

To the Land of DownLoadable Content and Challenges.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/5EB5LP9.png[/img]

You arrive in a hallway with a number of transportalizer pads. Each one leads to a different region of this land, each one a mini-land the size of a small country, ran by its own denizen.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/6lIm8le.png[/img]

There are many different ways to earn grist here, but there's one in particular that you're getting the itch for...

[img]https://i.imgur.com/iA2wI1J.png[/img]
[size=7](background elements generated by [url=https://huggingface.co/spaces/dalle-mini/dalle-mini]DALL E mini/Craion[/url])[/size]

This is it.

There is something about fighting that ignites your soul and truly makes you feel alive. 
It is fortunate that you can destroy countless enemies here with minimal guilt, knowing that the underlings here are simply constructs created by whichever denizen has jurisdiction of this region.

Time to kick some ass.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/5AUnE13.gif[/img]

Let's do this shit.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/8DbjUww.gif[/img]

These imps are no match for you.
[img]https://i.imgur.com/gga431Q.png[/img]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/Kd7bjRJ.gif[/img]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/eruZhpQ.png[/img]

You are now Rise. 
You have spent roughly 8 hours grinding for grist, with breaks for meals and such. You're fortunate in that there's a lot of decent places to get food in some of the regions there. 
Well, maybe not entirely fortunate, you did have an incident much earlier this year with a cat that swapped bodies with you for the singular purpose of ordering a burger from a particularly excellent burger place. 

That's in the past however and you have other things to think about now.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/Ak8OFsE.png[/img]

You begin to walk... in the wrong direction.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/VRh9WtC.png[/img]

After some initial confusion, you arrive in the hardware workshop. Not to be confused with the Hardwear Workshop beyond the nearby magicant entrance. 
(It's surprisingly easy to mix those two places up.)

It looks like this alchemiter should have all the tools you need. 
Now, how much grist have you accumulated today...

p.c: Rise: Observe your shit load of grist.
p.b:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/nklDQCb.gif[/img]

You don't need to check your grist counts, you know you have more than you could possibly count. You've been fighting for a good chunk of the day.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/EjA8I2U.png[/img]

What you really want to do though is alchemize some first aid supplies found off the internet.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/yVvJ2RU.gif[/img]

It ain't stealing if they could never sell it to you in the first place.
That being said, you would most definitely download a car if you wanted to.

p.c: Rise: Input code into alchemy app
p.b:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/5V93NqV.png[/img]

Time for a good old fashioned alchemy binge.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/tShDVyh.png[/img]

You start off with the bandages and some epsom salt. 
You're gonna want to take a nice relaxing bath once you get home.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/AtT92TX.png[/img]

After that, some antibiotic cream and some socks. You're not sure what the socks will be for, but they're a thing. The antibiotic cream will come in handy for your cuts and scrapes.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/nfViIr3.png[/img]

You combine a clean copy of your standard outfit with a fancysanta and manage to create the Brumal Eternal. 
Perhaps a little sophisticated for your tastes, but at least its warm and comfy.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/rmvo3q7.png[/img]

You also alchemize a pink knit hat for some reason.

[flash=640x480]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/left%20beef/alchemize.swf[/flash]
[size=7](tube in the back traced over the one found [url=https://www.deviantart.com/cdb-art/art/Human-Test-Tube-149628539]here[/url])[/size]
...huh, that actually worked.

p.c: Alchemiter: Proceed to unfold Jumper Extension due to lack of cards
p.b:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/m6FlfwH.png[/img]

The monkey's paw curls inwards, its foul deeds brought to fruition.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/Pde3HTS.png[/img]

Fortunately, you were able to captchalogue the mess that you had made off-screen. There's still some damage to the tile flooring, but that can be fixed later, when its not midnight over here.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/bA0shii.png[/img]
(used [url=https://flaringk.github.io/GifStuck/Alchemy/Alchemy.html]Flare's alchemy equation generator[/url] for these.)

You go ahead and alchemize a gristwidget (to satisfy Thoren's pacifistic desires) and this combo upgrade thing right here. 
Despite having two completely different functions, it seems to be a pretty solid package deal.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/0dfMne4.png[/img]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: heh... merry gristmas.[/color]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/HkTuki5.png[/img]

After travelling the usual route across various transportalizer links and flying roughly a quarter mile, you make it to Mt. Phoenix.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/ittSAZZ.png[/img]

You are so fucking sore from all that fighting earlier today.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/s30y1Zk.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#0000ff]June: hey rise. what happened?[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: Nothing too big, just fought a fuckton of underlings on that DLC planet.
Rise: I swear, I'm taking a bath as soon as I get a chance...[/color]
[color=#0000ff]June: yeah buddy, you look like you need one.
June: come on inside.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/T78jMuQ.png[/img]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: I'm dropping off this alchemiter bullshit and I'm going home.[/color]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/FpegSmQ.gif[/img]

You arrive in the workshop to find Thoren asleep on a conveyor belt. How embarrassing...

[img]https://i.imgur.com/I8ZEquP.png[/img]

That should do it.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/zdLYIjT.png[/img]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: I'll catch ya another time, June. Might wanna tell Raine that Thoren's knonked out downstairs. Rise: Do what you want with the alchemy set-up.[/color] [color=#0000ff]June: again? i swear they work themself way too hard...[/color]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/p5Oluct.png[/img] You are now June, and you are currently seeing Rise out on their way back home, apparently.
[color=#0000ff]June: seeya rise.[/color]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/tndoM1E.png[/img]

With that handled, you figure you should check on Thoren and make sure they have what they need for the night. Sleep mode is useless for charging if they aren't plugged in, after all.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/MgQsWfn.png[/img]

The first thing you do upon going downstairs is turn off that damn conveyor belt.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/jmjmSur.gif[/img]

After that you plug them into an outlet and cover them in a blanket. You're not sure if the blanket does anything for them, but its at least nice to wake up with a blanket in the morning.

...wait, what is that.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/NaJ5ycD.png[/img]

A captchalogue card... Is that yours?
(This is of course a rhetorical question, as June cannot perceive the narration like Thoren can.)

[img]https://i.imgur.com/uKqLaMN.png[/img]

You uncaptchalogue the contents of that catcha card and you find two items, a blacked-out letter with glow in the dark writing, and a teal flash drive.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/OhYxG5Q.png[/img]

Oh come on! Who the hell sent this letter anyways?!

p.c: June: Read the letter out loud
p.b:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/te81KaG.gif[/img]

Unfortunately, sticking the flash drive into Thoren's back took priority?! 

I wanna read that letter!

The flash drive seems to be saving some data, but I'm not sure what data and why and its kinda making me anxious here.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/9OhONKF.gif[/img]
[color=#0000ff]June: alright... looks like i've got that step done... now to jump back i guess? June: i really hope this doesn't mess up anything important.[/color]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/AZsFFwL.gif[/img]

And off she goes...

(note to the reader: this retcon trail will modify existing pages. This is only tracked locally, so you'll need to access the page after going to this one first. If this doesn't work properly, its likely the JS needs to be verified still.)

[img]https://i.imgur.com/mHNB32m.gif[/img]

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#0000ff]June: hiya thoren! we've got a mission to do.[/color]
[color=#c20000]Thoren: June, what's going on?[/color]
[color=#0000ff]June: remember? operation saving private mistletoe?[/color]
[color=#c20000]Thoren: ...I see. Let me prepare for a moment first.[/color]
[color=#0000ff]June: we got plenty of time. just lemme know when you're ready to do the combo jump with me.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/ia0XyNd.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#c20000]Thoren: So tell me, what was the catalyst to your appearance here?[/color]
[color=#0000ff]June: oh, i got a piece of paper and a flash drive that popped up or something. 
June: it looks like it was mine but the writing on the paper doesn't look like mine.[/color]
[color=#c20000]Thoren: May I see this paper?[/color]
[color=#0000ff]June: lemme check, its got some weird demands on it.
June: oh cool, i am allowed to hand it over.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/qawi5Ve.png[/img]

Aughagh... I swear, this paper has it out for me.

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#c20000]Thoren: Hm... it doesn't appear to mention Mistletoe anywhere on here. It simply goes over the steps needed to shield the house from the[/color] [color=#ff0000]Red Dome[/color][color=#c20000].[/color]
[color=#0000ff]June: huh, that's weird. i don't remember it saying much about that when i read it. looking at it right now, its still like that for me![/color]
[color=#c20000]Thoren: I have a suspicion that there is something peculiar about this mysterious note.[/color]
[color=#0000ff]June: you're telling me! something's fishy here.[/color]
[color=#c20000]Thoren: Such an enigmatic artifact may very well be our only clue to how to proceed though, I'm afraid.[/color][/spoiler]

oh shit, gotta scram!
