ST and SC go chasing after the airborne Mage, caught by the powerful gale!
It appears those three over there will be busy for a while.

[color=#c6bc9f]ââ¦ Looks like those three are having a time of it, and where did this storm come fromâ¦?â[/color]

[url=https://mspfa.com/?s=38989&p=842]Meanwhile, a familiar heir of breath is gradually approaching the wind-whipped land, with a certain someone with her![/url]
With her mastery over the wind, the breath player has no issue navigating the storm with her new partner...

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/dreamquest11b.png[/img]

[color=#00ff00]âI just saw two players appear in a flash, is that who weâre looking for?â[/color] RN says, flickering different filters on and off to get a clear visual through the blizzard.

Jovin focused on the two that popped in. [color=#c6bc9f]âOh hey thatâs ja-jo-a certain hair of breath! I think thatâs themâ[/color]

[color=#ff0000]"That means we're right on schedule."[/color]
Rise is currently nursing a sudden headache from the hole that June punched into the already messy timespace fabric, while still gripping the blanket they're hiding under.

[color=#ff0000]"Now according to the [alt=(This comic)]mage's comic[/alt], they should be entering the dome soon. Once they disappear and then reappear, which I can unfortunately sense with my sensitivity to changes in Time, that will be when we need to get into position." 
"I plan on finding a spot in the hallway leading to the main area of the dream dome and falling asleep there with Gallade's assistance. I will also have Atlas, my machoke, act as a bodyguard. When the final splitting headache subsides after The Stage is made, that will be the signal to move in." 
"If either of you also want to start the confrontation with a dream buffer, just let me know."[/color]

[color=#c6bc9f]"...Ya need anything? Pain meds, more food, me to shut up, people to stop doing time stuff?" [/color]Jovin nods and sighs, cracking his hands and knuckles. 

[color=#ff0000]"I could really use something for this headache. Maybe some ibuprofen."[/color]

[color=#c6bc9f]"And just lead me to the right place, and I'll uh move in... what is the the plan by the way? and uh whats a dream bugger? Also can lend you some of my mons if you want more protection"[/color]

[color=#ff0000]"As for dream buffer, you know how when you get attacked in a dream you just wake up? Considering the danger we're going in, not to mention the Heroic judgement any of us would easily get in this, taking advantage of the dream dome's dreambubble shit to appear there in a dream will give us just that much more protection."[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/dreamquest12.png[/img]

On cue, a bottle of Ibuprofen falls out of RNâs Miracle Modus. He hands it to you. 
[color=#00ff00]âHere you go FI.â [/color]
He thinks for a moment, before asking a question. [color=#00ff00]â..Have things gotten better in your time?â[/color]

[color=#c6bc9f]"Oh nice, thats handy. And... yeah. can't tell ya specifics cause of the trousers of time and don't want to split things off but... things be better. And Quiet."[/color]

You so desperately want to tell RN about how much better it is in the future, about how RN will find herself, a new 9 foot tall robot cat girlfriend, and only really have to worry about troubles on thursdays. Granted, the future isn't all sunshine, but it's certainly better than the desolation and silent cacophony of the furthest ring.

You accept the ibuprofen and attempt to take a couple with some coffee.
[color=#ff0000]"Thank you. Yeah, it is better. A lot-"[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/dreamquest13.png[/img]

Unfortunately, fortune is not smiling upon you in this sunless realm.
Not only do you drop the pill bottle, but you also let go of the blanket, which goes flying off to places unknown.
[color=#ff0000]"...fuck. I'm sorry about that."[/color]
And as if that wasn't enough, you begin to lose balance, knocking over the coffee carafe. It goes spilling down the chain, quickly getting warm coffee on Jovin below.
[color=#ff0000]"Whowhoaaa!"[/color]
You could topple any moment!
Jovin suffers as the items hit him, but his resolve to protect you from falling is strong!

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/dreamquest14.png[/img]

Acting on reflex, you manage to keep Rise balanced! However, one of their pokeballs goes tumbling down. Fortunately, the pokemon inside escapes from the descending capsule. 
It's Gallade!
Sensing his trainer's distress, Gallade leaps up the chain to join the group once more.
You breathe a sigh of relief.

p.c: Jovin: Offer advil and check Rise's Temperature
p.b:
[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/dreamquest15.png[/img]

[color=#c6bc9f]"Okay, ya are NOT in a good state..." [/color]

You take out a bottle of advil, free hand pressing against their forehead to check their temperature. It is hard to tell if their temperature is higher or lower than usual. Have you ever checked their temperature before? It is however noticeable that their skin has a rougher texture than possibly expected, though likely not by much. 

[color=#c6bc9f]"...Man, ya be chilly. And don't worry bout the stuff ya dropped. Ya more important."[/color]

Rise soon begins crying.
[color=#ff0000]"What am I even doing... I can't save anyone like this... Have I really gotten too soft?"[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/dreamquest16.png[/img]

Jovin and RN offer you a hug. You usually aren't used to so much physical contact, but at this point, you need it. Messages of encouragement from everyone in contact give you the strength to find confidence again.

[color=#00ff00]"You can do it FI, we're here to help you."[/color]

[color=#c6bc9f]"Don't worry... everyone gets an off day, and you already traveled in time twice... And hey, we be here to help out. We be a team."[/color]

Even your sister from across the network offers you her hope and warmth.
[color=#d5aa00][i]'Rise, you're one of the strongest people I know. If anyone can do this, it's you.'[/i][/color]

All these people are here to work with you, for a cause that you believe in.

A memory of the epiphany you had on top of Mt. Coronet comes to mind, when your pokemon carried you through your trials, and even lead you to your bedroom when it was all said and done. 
Gallade gives you a thumbs-up.

[color=#ff0000]"...thank you. I'm glad you're here with me."[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/dreamquest17.png[/img]

As you prepare for the tasks ahead, you offer a few potential strategies to the others.

[color=#ff0000]"...Alright. I think I can handle things now."
"RN, while you haven't reached the point in the timeline where you personally rescued Dylan from a horrorterror yet, just the fact that you're here to rescue him from a voidco recruiter even before that will help a lot with your credibility with talking to him. Offer Dylan your [/color][color=#ffff80]Hope[/color][color=#ff0000]."
"Jovin, You said you've mostly got buffs and debuffs, right? We're likely to need debuffs on this enemy. I'm not entirely sure how hit-able someone with a dark aura like that, but maybe you can make a dent with your[/color] [color=#8c00ff]Rage[/color][color=#ff0000]." 
"As for me, I've got my pokemon as mentioned before, and can make a pretty decent distraction if needed. I can buy Time. Any questions?"[/color]

Jovin and RN both nod.

[color=#c6bc9f]âMakes senseâ¦ Iâll do my best to keep their attention on me- and even if canât debug them, call roar pretty loud and try and deafen them, or shoot lighting at that.â[/color]

[color=#00ff00]âJust let me know when itâs time to head down there.â[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/dreamquest18.png[/img]

Soon enough, the group makes their way back towards the dream dome. Fortunately, the storm has mostly calmed down, making the trip easier.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/dreamquest19.png[/img]

Rise takes a deep breath.
[color=#ff0000]"...okay. First of all, if anyone dies permanently here... I'm dooming the timeline until we get an outcome where we all survive. Got that?"[/color]
Rise takes a moment to let the gravity of their statement sink in.

RN nods, well aware of the risks.

[color=#c6bc9f]âIâm honestly more worried about you two- Iâm pretty damn hard to kill. And uh alrightâ¦ donât like dooming folks butâ¦â[/color] Jovin shrugs.

[color=#ff0000]"Secondly, do either of you two want to start the confrontation asleep?"[/color]

[color=#00ff00]âMy Imagination stat is more powerful when awake.â[/color]

[color=#c6bc9f]âdreaming thing does sound like a gild buff butâ¦ with my headspace, not sure if Iâd be the only one dreaming if that makes senseâ¦â[/color] Jovin shrugs again, stretching as he pulls out a metal bat. 
[color=#c6bc9f]âShould be okay with the dream buff but uh expect some weirdnessâ¦â[/color]

[color=#ff0000]"Alright. Let's enter the hallway first."[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/dreamquest20.png[/img]

Rise walks to the double doors and pushes one open.
Beyond the door is darkness.
An ominous darkness.
A darkness that threatens to make your blood run cold.

Rise takes a deep breath.
[color=#ff0000]"...here goes nothing."[/color]

Rise steps into the darkness beyond the threshold, the rest of the party following behind.

...The silhouette of a bloody corpse is revealed.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/dreamquest21.png[/img]

[color=#00ff00]"Welp."[/color]
[color=#ff0000]"..." [/color]
[color=#c6bc9f]âoh Buggerâ[/color]
Rise tenses. They take a look at the body.
It's a copy of their own.
The bloodstains stand out starkly against the white coat.

They check to try and see the cause of death.
A massive bleeding hole punched through the victim's chest answers that quickly.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/dreamquest22.png[/img]

You try to control your breathing.
It's just a doomed timeclone.
It's just a doomed timeclone.
It's just YOUR OWN DEAD BODY RIGHT IN FRONT OF YOU.

Brae's comfort tries to soothe your troubled heart from across the network.
Thoughts of home...

Meanwhile, Jovin goes into survival mode. This situation may wind up getting dangerous if they don't stay on their toes here.
[color=#c6bc9f]"...Couldn't tell if it was from the back, or from the front. Would tell us alot about how person who did this handle things, so we can [/color][color=#8c00ff][size=20]END THEM.[/size][/color][color=#c6bc9f]"[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/dreamquest23.png[/img]

You captchalogue the dead body and an imaginary towel stained with real blood. Next time you uncaptcha that second thing, you'll likely only have the blood. The body however, is very real. Fortunately you added censor pixelation to your array modus if a dead body or something similarly triggering is detected. 
The less time you have to stare at that body, the sooner you can calm down.

[color=#ff0000]"...when we get home, we need to give this one a proper burial."[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/dreamquest24.png[/img]

A moment passes, and there is [url=https://mspfa.com/?s=38989&p=878]a flash from the other end of the hallway[/url]. You cringe from the inevitable headache that follows.

You let out your trusty machoke, Atlas, to help protect the party.

p.c: Rise: attempt to conjure imaginary beds
p.b:
[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/dreamquest25.gif[/img]

[size=20][b][color=#ff0000]"AAAAAAAAAAAAAGGGGHHHH!!!!!"[/color][/b][/size]

You not only fail to do this, but you also topple over from the worst headache you ever experienced in your entire life, [url=https://mspfa.com/?s=38989&p=887]courtesy of June Egbert[/url]. You feel like your head is going to fucking explode!

Fortunately, your friends got your back, Hazel conjuring a single bed, and Jovin making sure you land in the right place.

[color=#c6bc9f]"I have bedrolls if we need them- but fuck... I'm guessing the time fuckery is getting to he-them! Your going to be okay Ri-FI, fuck I wish could use real names... If you want I can try and Limit the uh energy you feel..."[/color]

[color=#00ff00]ââ¦Christ, did you two piss off a Light Player? Weâre getting super unlucky.â[/color]
little did they know, a certain dice maiden did in fact have it out for them-- but that's a bit of a tangent already.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/dreamquest26.png[/img]

[color=#c6bc9f]"We might not be able to do the dream thing, given ya state... try and recover, I'll leave my mons to watch over ya till ya can join us but... moment is approaching"[/color]

You attempt to cover Rise's mouth with your hand, and it winds up getting bitten. In the heat of the moment, you can barely even feel it. You also try to wipe the blood off Rise's nose. 

[color=#c6bc9f]"There it's its fine, bite if ya need to, pain is well... painful. But the good thing is that it does go away- either cause ya not in a painful situation or... ya get used to it. Hopefully the former case here..."[/color]

Meanwhile, RN decides to go on ahead to see what's going on beyond the hallway.

[color=#c6bc9f]"I'll join ya in a second."[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/dreamquest27.png[/img]

You let out a number of your own pokemon to accompany Rise for their protection.

[color=#c6bc9f]"I would really rather stay and make sure ya okay but... we dragged them into this, rather them not die and then things getting doomed. Ya recover as best ya can, okay? I'll do my best to take care of this. Not gonna limit things cause... might need it."[/color]

You manage to get your hand free of Rise's chompers with minimal complications, fortunately.

[color=#c6bc9f]"...Ya stronger then ya think ya are, you know? Brief Stumble like this doesn't mean ya stay down, ya just gotta get back up when ya can. But don't push yaself."[/color]

And with that, you make your way down the hall to catch up with RN, leaving Rise with the assortment of pokemon.

p.c: Dylan: Run like hell! This guy works for Voidspawn like the one that used you as a mouth piece!!!
p.b:
[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq1.png[/img]

You are very wary of this mysterious businessperson, but you can't shake the feeling that they look... familiar somehow?

[color=#00ff00]"Leave them alone, VoidCo Scum!"[/color]

The voice from [color=#c100c1]The Stage[/color] catches your attention! Is that...
The recruiter just glares at the distant figure.

[color=#386276]"And so The Hero arrives, right on cue. Tell me, do you fear judgement?"[/color]

[color=#408080]"Hey, knock it off!"[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq2.png[/img]

You are now this guy. Your name is Jovin and you are FUCKING PISSED. However, you know when to hold your temper in a dangerous situation. Something that you learned about Rage after a couple thousand years.

[color=#386276]"...Directionless himbo, I know you're lurking."[/color]

...oh shit.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq3.png[/img]

Okay so either you're very bad at sneaking, this asshole is very perceptive, or he has some kind of bullshit extra sensory sense.
[color=#c6bc9f]âBugger really hoped ya wouldnât noticeâ¦ and I see ya know of me, but ya have me at a disadvantage, for I have no idea who ya shadowy ass is, expect working from VoidCo whichâ¦ gonna be honest with ya, makes me very disinclined to like yaâ[/color]

[color=#386276]"At least you have a sense of reason. Unfortunately, you are too late. The future has been written, and the seed has been planted. Your precious Dylan is fated to follow in my footsteps. A path that you do not approve of, but one that the child will appreciate."[/color]

[color=#c6bc9f]âSo you say butâ¦ the future is written less in permanent marker and more in erasable pencil lead at times, and a seed when planted, may grow differently even if planted in the same spot.â [/color]

[color=#408080]"Do you have to call me a child? I'm like... really old."[/color]

Soon after, Dylan glances over at you. He has no idea who you are. The one in armor however, he remembers quite well.

[color=#386276]"Old in years, but not in experience. There are tricks you have yet to learn."[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq4.png[/img]

[color=#00ff00]âThis is a dreambubble! You could just be disguised as Dylan!â [/color]

You glance back at Dylan for a second. 
[color=#c6bc9f]âand oh? How old are ya? If I uh may askâ¦ also uh, terrible at namesâ¦ what ya two names? And have a feeling this is time stuffâ¦â[/color]

Dylan answers Jovin's question.
[color=#408080]"It's... Hard to keep track of the years. I've spent most of my life in the furthest ring. I first got here when I was 16, if that makes any difference."[/color]

The one in the suit entertains the theories floated about him.
[color=#386276]"Perhaps I could be disguised, perhaps my path is not the one this one will follow. But what if I am of the canon future? As for my name, my name is Dylan."[/color]

[color=#408080]"...hey, that's my name!"[/color]

[color=#c6bc9f]"Yeah...Get that. Began loosing track of how old I was at a thousand years or so... just know it's been at least 3 eons for me. And Nice to meet ya both, Dylan and Dylan"[/color]

[color=#386276]"Not to mention... What if you want to become as powerful as me, young Dylan?"[/color]

Young Dylan thinks for a moment.
[color=#408080]"I'm... not sure what I want. Like, it would be nice to be powerful, but like, what's the point of being powerful anyway?"[/color]

Elder Dylan twists his own hair with his fingers.
[color=#386276]"There is minimal point in most things. What I do with my power is give others purpose when there is none. What use is being a hero if there are none that need to be saved? What use is godly power if all simply follow the laws that mortals write? What would you two from the stage do with your time if you did not have a scapegoat cloaked in darkness to pin your woes upon?"[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq7.png[/img]

You are now RN. You continue to approach the two Dylans.

[color=#c6bc9f]"In the longest run, most things don't matter as much but... it's also pretty boring taking that point of view. And sounds like ya define yaself by what others think of you, and yeah... being a modern hero means having people to save which means they must be in danger to be saved from which... kinda sucks but what can you do. And power usually comes at a price, and mortal laws are there for a reason."[/color]

[color=#00ff00]ââ¦I took the Choice to be powerful, to push my abilities as far as I could. And after the war was lost, it left me alone surrounded by the guilt of the ghosts I let down. Power for Powerâs Sake will break you.â[/color]

[color=#c6bc9f]"...If didn't have that[/color] [color=#c100c1][size=14]FUCKER[/size][/color] [color=#c6bc9f]to blame for it, probably be long either dead or uh still alive but not having nearly as good a life but still be able to remember my parents faces at least... Instead, got some minor issues,3000 or so years of mostly happy wedded life memories along with some sad ones but hey thats life, and good friends. But yeah, Only Strived for Power cause... had to survive at first, and then just trained cause it's something to do and so I can call upon it if needed"[/color]

[color=#386276]"The power you chose was of combat. The power I chose, was corporate power. The power of the pen and the bottom line."[/color]

Elder Dylan stands resolute.
[color=#386276]"But you see, this is exactly why you all need a company like voidco. We offer a valuable service that few are wiling to provide. Without a common enemy, you heroes would destroy yourselves. The game does not build us to so easily coexist in times of peace, only meant to allow it to propagate its cosmic cycle, and then be discarded."[/color]

[color=#386276]"Beyond the scope of Skaia's light, the scars of its eternal wars etch into our souls. Without a direction, we carry strife within us at our own peril."[/color]

Elder Dylan looks down upon his supposedly younger self.
[color=#386276]"Young Dylan. Do you not wish to give these warriors direction beyond their original callings?"
[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq5.png[/img]

You are now Rise and you are... probably dreaming? It's harder to feel the pain that felt like your head was going to split open, at least. You sense an amount of concern over the Network. A brief curious query from your mom-friend, and some discussion with your sister.

Out of respect, I will not publish the heartlog here.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq6.png[/img]

Eventually, my Light arrives upon you, having been delivered by Brae across The Network.
You are now calmed and boosted with Light! Your actions will have less chance of failure for the time being.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq8.png[/img]

You walk out onto the stage and meet up with Jovin, who is knee-deep in a ramble.

[color=#c6bc9f]"Nah... Think ya be missing the point a bit. Without conflict, I decided to explore and such, and found a family when I thought I would be alone. Causing Conflict for conflict sake isn't a good idea... and yeah, the game was a dick like that. But here's the thing- we are Free from it now, and we get to choose what we do with the 'gifts' or 'curses' or 'power' or 'trauma' that it forced upon us. I am a bit of a battle junkie at times but... peace is good as well. And would rather we get to choose what we do, rather then forced upon us, if ya don't mind"[/color]

[color=#ff0000]"Sorry about being late, had to gather my bearings. What's the situation?"[/color]

[color=#c6bc9f]"Yeah not much going on right now just engaging in a thing that is more dangerous then fighting- Philosophy. Nice to see ya up and about."[/color]

[color=#ff0000]"...thanks."[/color]

[color=#386276]"And so The Star finally arrives. You thought you could change things, couldn't you?"[/color]

Rise manages to keep a grip on their temper, for the most part.
[color=#ff0000]"Who the fuck do you think you are?"[/color]

[color=#386276]"I suppose you missed the introductions. I am Dylan, the elder one."[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq9.png[/img]

[color=#00ff00]"Look, Dylan.. Dylans, even. You don't have to be the bad guy. Thatâs probably a quote from a kids movie or something, but itâs true. Evil will always exist, but even if VoidCo does magically collapse without you propping it up, life will still have meaning. Itâs what we make of it that matters, not what railroaded shit Chronos or Horrorterrors or whoever else sets out for us."[/color]

[color=#408080]"...Outfielder. You make it sound like growing up is a bad thing. I'm sorry about this but... I've wanted to go into business for a while now, and... Maybe it's not as tragic as it seems. I know the territory out here better than anywhere else. I feel at home in the void. More than I ever did in anywhere else. And who knows? Maybe I could reform the company from the inside?"
[/color]
[color=#ff0000]"You really believe that crap?"[/color] Rise hollers from the stage.

[color=#408080]"You wouldn't understand! You care more about your own life than the life of anyone else!"[/color] Young Dylan hollers back.

[color=#ff0000]"Says the little shit that sold out to my bastard father and let him take over my body!"[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq10.png[/img]

[color=#408080]"IF YOU WERE BOUND AND GAGGED BY A HORRORTERROR TO THE POINT YOU COULDN'T FEEL PAIN ANYMORE, YOU WOULD DO WHAT I DID TOO!"[/color]

[color=#386276]"Is this a schism I detect?"[/color] Elder Dylan comments.

[color=#408080]"Let me swing my own bat, slendertwink."[/color]

[color=#c6bc9f]"...Great, I love it when plot stuff happens and it flies over my head cause I have no idea of the context." [/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq11.png[/img]

[color=#408080]"Do you realize how much shit I've done for you, you ungrateful heir? I literally set up that stage, directed the pawns to use it soon, AND ran through your mind to shut it down! I am the reason you're allowed to exist!"
"Without me, you'd be nothing! Without me, Korous wouldn't have been possible! Without me, the entire Gene universe, with all of its instances, wouldn't be possible either!"[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq12.png[/img]

[color=#408080]"Let me live my own life!"[/color]

A shadowed figure steps out from behind younger Dylan. It takes a moment for it to take full shape, but it soon resolves to a very familiar figure.
A twisted version of Rise, formed from Dylan's experiences in speedrunning Thoren's mind-path.

"Or Else."

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq17.png[/img]

[color=#c6bc9f]"...Huh... didn't know hope could make evil copies of others. Cool to know... Want me to handle evil you? Know it be cool to have a mirror match with yourself but..."
[/color]
[color=#ff0000]"Jovin, you don't need hope to make up a fake version of somebody. I've already fought this clown before, though maybe this is the first time on their end."[/color]

 [color=#c6bc9f]"...I think confronting Dylan should be left to ya since ya know him...[/color] [color=#8c00ff]also gonna get loud for a second sorry.."[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq13.png[/img]

[size=20][color=#8c00ff]"Hey dude, ya gave us life, just trying to return the favor and make sure ya don't waste yours!"[/color][/size]

p.c: RN: Show them what kinda people you can summon with real hope powers
p.b:
[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq14.png[/img]

With your high IMAGINATION stat, you are able to leverage the power of the dream dome to access The Network from Rise, and summon the member that most resembles yourself!

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq15.gif[/img]

Hazel is summoned to the field in debate mode!

[color=#00ff00]âWhat the..? Oh, I see your idea here, [background=#000000]Redacted[/background]. Well, letâs make this argument a fair ballgame, Dylanâ[/color]

RN is puzzled at what he sees.
[color=#00ff00]âWhy am I a-â[/color]

[color=#00ff00]âYouâll figure it out, kid. Focus on the ball here.â[/color]

[color=#00ff00]âRight, rightâ[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq16.png[/img]

You are now Ruse. You have just manifested in front of other people for the first time. Previously you had been confined to Dylan's mind, but thankfully this dream dome is well accommodating to those of imaginary nature. 

You study the loser that looks a lot like you on that stage.

"So you're the one I'm based off of? What scent of perfume do you use?"

Rise flips you off, not making any moves yet.
You reciprocate the bird, though you make sure to keep an eye on the banyanarmored duo.

Hazel begins her argument.
[color=#00ff00]âAnyway, Dylan. You want to go into business, fine. Thereâs ethical enough companies in Gene. But look at this agent, talking about how âneededâ VoidCo is and parroting their propaganda. If they are you, then why did I pull you out of that âterror in the first place? If youâre wanting to go right back into being their mouthpiece.â[/color]

Young Dylan blinks at the appearance of another copy of the one who saved him years ago, before regaining his composure.
[color=#408080]"With this path, I'll never have to take a lowly position like that ever again. This will not be a waste. All who crawl from the darkness shall do my bidding. I will serve no one, and I shall become untouchable."[/color]

[color=#ff0000]"Good luck getting anywhere with that attitude,"[/color] Rise adds sarcastically.

Elder Dylan cuts in from the back.
[color=#386276]"He won't need luck, I will make sure he gets exactly what he needs to make it to the top."[/color]

[color=#408080]"It will all be worth it. I'll even be able to get my revenge."[/color]

p.c: Rise: Imagination manifest a version of your sister, because Ruse has never known what love is like.
p.b:
[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq20.png[/img]

[color=#c6bc9f]"Revenge on who? The horror terrors that did bad shit to ya?"[/color] Jovin asks as he hoped off the stage, his landing louder then it should have been and leaving cracks where he landed, before walking towards younger Dylan, war club in a ready stance as rage energy continued to crackle around him.

[color=#408080]"Exactly."[/color] Younger Dylan answers Jovin.

Hazel gives Jovin a Look in response to the Rage Club.
[color=#00ff00]"Donât escalate to a fight, itâs what he wants."[/color]

Meanwhile, Rise is focused on a conversation with their sister across The Network. They decide to summon her to the battlefield. Or rather, she decided and they agreed to follow through.

Focusing on their connection, Rise summons a tangible representation of their bond to Brae, a thick glowing rope now in their hands. Rise gives it a tug. She should be able to manifest here in her dreams if she follows the source of the pull.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq18.png[/img]

[color=#00ff00]"Are you going to tell him what you actually do for a living, Secret Agent Man? Youâve been making a lot of seemingly deep statements about the nature of good and evil, but you havenât really lined up the actual job pitch."[/color]

Elder Dylan pushes up his glasses, an ever present glare blocking the sight of his eyes.
Second base elevates below his feet, making Elder Dylan stand taller than anyone else. He pulls out a small metal case and produces pitch black business card between his fingers.
He then gracefully zings it towards the pitcher's mound.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq19.png[/img]

The card sticks into the dirt like a shuriken. It dusts off just as easily.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq21.png[/img]

To the untrained eye, it appears there is nothing on the card at all, just the abyssal black of the endless void in rectangular form. 
The texture of the paper is exquisite. It could make a sufficiently savvy businessman cry.
Upon staring into the darkness however, it stares back, and you immediately know a single secret that shakes you to your core.

-- Dylan [REDACTED] CEO of Voidco. --

[color=#386276]"As if you haven't guessed, I run this show."[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq22.gif[/img]

Upon being read, the card explodes, knocking you down. It probably won't hurt too much. Probably.

Younger Dylan and Ruse are surprised by the small explosion, on guard.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq23.png[/img]

After enough pulling, Brae appears in the dream dome!

[color=#d5aa00]"Ow.."[/color]

[color=#ff0000]"Brae, you made it!"[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq24.png[/img]

Standing up, Brae dusts herself off and looks around, her hands on her hips as she surveys her surroundings. She spots Ruse and Dylan, moving one hand off her hip to point at the both of them.
[color=#d5aa00]"Hey! I don't know what you think you're doing, but if you think this is the route you need to take to gain some semblance of control over yourself, you're actually just walking right back into their open tentacles!"[/color]

[color=#408080]"I am in complete control,"[/color] Dylan states plainly.
Its spoken so darkly that it's hard to tell which one said it.

"What are you gonna do with that, throw it at us?" Ruse questions Brae, in an almost mocking tone.

[color=#d5aa00]"Yes, actually I am!"[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq29.gif[/img]

You hurl the lemonbomb at Younger Dylan and Ruse!

p.c: Dylan: You know what has to be done.
p.b:
[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq30.gif[/img]

With your baseball instincts in overdrive, you know exactly what must be done. You pull out your slugger and strike the lemonbomb!

POP!
...Confetti and two conspicuous photos fall out.
Not what you expected, but it beats getting an explosion to the face.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq31.png[/img]

Young Dylan and Ruse pick up the two photos. They are both struck by the acknowledgement of the immense loneliness that fills them both, though Ruse's loneliness is likely just a projection of Dylan's own. 
Their friends and family... They would be leaving this behind. 

[color=#408080]"..."[/color]

"Why can't I have a sister like the real me does?"

[color=#408080]"...We have no need for sisters, or the affection they provide. We have grown past such things."[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq25.png[/img]

"But-"

[color=#408080]"...We have more important things to tend to."[/color]

[color=#8c00ff]"Hope ya prepared two graves then- ya know that saying bout revenge and such..."[/color]

You prepare to run towards third base when suddenly...

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq26.gif[/img]

You are launched into the air by the home plate!

[color=#8c00ff][size=30]"[u]AAHHHH[/u][/size][size=25]HOOOOO[/size][size=20]OOOOOOOH[/size][size=30]HOOOOOIU!"[/size][/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq27.png[/img]

You crash straight into the extruded tower of second base!

[color=#ff0000]"Maybe you should listen to that anime scribble you've got there."[/color] Rise adds from the back.

"WHO ASKED YOU?!" The doppelganger snaps.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq28.gif[/img]

Meanwhile, Elder Dylan lifts off of the extruded base that he had been standing upon, now structurally compromised by the force Jovin's hard head.
[color=#386276]"Dylan, enough playing around with these fools. We have places to be going."[/color]

The towering plate could topple at any moment.

Meanwhile, Hazel snaps out of her daze and starts to drag RN towards the Stage, retreating from the VoidCo CEO on the tower of plates.
[color=#00ff00]"â¦i donât want to see what heâs capable of."[/color]

Elder Dylan floats and watches.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq36.png[/img]

Everyone suddenly has a cupcake, courtesy of Coleman. 

Jovin quickly dislodges himself from the tower-like base.
[color=#c6bc9f]"...Lets all agree that I meant to do that" [/color]
[color=#8c00ff]"Gonna run are we? And yeah, ya gonna listen to card-carrying villain possible future ya, Dylan, or ya gonna decide things for ya self?"[/color] Jovin asks, glancing at the towering plate before him... 
He then grabs it, fingers sinking into the material and then lifting it up, rage energy traveling from his body to the column, hopefully making it so it doesn't break.

Jovin glares at elder Dylan and intends on using it as a giant club.

Elder Dylan stays up and out of range of the giant bludgeon. He need not come any closer to the ground at this point.

Hazel continues to drag her pre-transition self towards the Stage, the two cupcakes automatically sorting into Patrickâs Miracle Modus.

Meanwhile, Rise and Brae are too overwhelmed to do much of anything in this situation.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq33.png[/img]

Your name is Dylan, and you are standing at a crossroads in your life.
You have been presented with a Choice: either Go Big, or Go Home.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq32.png[/img]

Most of the people here want you to Go Home. They would be hurt if you went off to become what they see as an Evil Businessman. They don't want to see you join their enemy.
They would be alright with you becoming an average businessman, but that path doesn't appeal to you.

You have greater ambitions. Aspirations. Grand designs.
You want to make a name for yourself. You want power. You want vengeance.
What glory is there in an average life? One that any sufficiently privileged mortal could lead?
You want more than they can offer you in Gene. You'd be willing to go down in infamy if it meant you'd be more than just a footnote in history.

What about that promise you made to your sister? To never deal with tentacle monsters ever again? 
You only made that promise so she wouldn't be worried about you.

She leads her own life now, and you ought to do the same.
Besides, if you play your cards right, you'll have enough proxies that you'll never have to contact one directly.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq34.png[/img]

In hindsight, the choice was obvious.

You choose to Go Big, and leave those that want otherwise for you behind.

[color=#408080]"...My decisions are my own."[/color]

You pull out a pair of glasses and put them on, obscuring your eyes.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq35.png[/img]

You lift off the ground and ascend to meet your destiny.

[color=#386276]"I knew you would make the right choice."[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq37.png[/img]

Thoren has returned from a fighting tournament. Upon returning to their home dimension, they sense turmoil across The Network and contact its members to investigate.

[spoiler open="Show Heartlog" close="Hide Heartlog"]
[i][color=#c20000]'Greetings. I have returned from Fight Fest. I did not win. The tank-like machine they matched me up against was entirely out of my league. How are the others doing?'[/color]

[color=#d5aa00]It's rare, but Brae is just radiating Angy right now.[/color]

[color=#ff0000]Angry and upset[/color]

[color=#00ff00]Terror[/color]

[color=#c20000]'Hazel, are you alright?' worry[/color]

[color=#d5aa00]'You have to be added to the Network, right? Different versions of Rise aren't in here by default? And Ruse doesn't count as an authentic Rise duplicate?'[/color]

[color=#c20000]'Those who die permanently are removed from the network upon expiration and must be added back manually.'
'I am unsure who is Ruse.[/color]'

[color=#00ff00]:3 Canât talk, retreating from the VoidCo CEO :3[/color]

[color=#c20000]![/color]

[color=#d5aa00]'Does the name Dylan ring any bells?'[/color]

[color=#c20000]'...yes. The baseball enthusiast from the furthest ring. One of the few to ever treat me with respect during my timeloop-enforced descent into darkness.'[/color]

[color=#d5aa00]'That's who the CEO is. Older Dylan.'[/color]

[color=#c20000][ Processing... ][/color]

[color=#d5aa00]'And Ruse is some manifestation of Rise that comes from Dylan too.'[/color]

[color=#ff0000]'Ruse was that imaginary asshole that terrorized me and the others a few years ago at that shitty resort, and last year challenged me to a pokemon battle.'[/color]

[color=#d5aa00]'Though their personality is distinctly younger-Rise-esque.'[/color]

[color=#c20000]'...There is something wrong with this picture. Why does Dylan have an immature imprint of Rise's template? And why is Dylan the fucking CEO of Voidco?'[/color]

[color=#ff0000]'I have no fucking idea. Maybe he's obsessed with me for some weirdass reason? He was the reason why I was stuck in that shitty coma years ago when I was possessed by... [/color][color=#000000]You Know Who[/color][color=#ff0000].'[/color]

[color=#c20000]'...'
'I may need to perform some research into this matter.'
'For the time being, I will be returning to Starter Planet, for best access to available information.'[/color][/i]
[/spoiler]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/dreamquest/lb3-dq37a.png[/img]

[color=#c20000]"I'm not your puppet."[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-615.png[/img]

After a grueling journey across time space and canon and beyond, you finally land somewhere and somewhen remotely familiar.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-616.png[/img]

Your head is absolutely spinning right now.

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#0000ff]June: uh, hey everybody.[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Katie: Heya June![/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...what happened to you?[/color]
[color=#0000ff]June: agh...
June: honestly i can't remember.[/color]
[color=#a58a40]Coleman: hey june.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...dont worry about it right now, It hopefully won't come up again. And if it has to, I imagine you won't have any problems then.[/color]
[color=#d5aa00]Brae: Drunk on eggnog. Eggnog hangover.[/color]
[color=#0000ff]June: i hope so.
June: i don't think i'm drunk though.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: Yeah I'm... not gonna have any eggnog.[/color]
[color=#0000ff]June: anyone got any ibuprophen or something?[/color]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: I do! [/color][/spoiler]

After a quick trip downstairs, you return with the pills and a bottle of water.

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#0000ff]June: thanks.[/color]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: mhmm.
Mei: The water is all yours, by the way.[/color]
[color=#0000ff]June: thanks again.[/color]
[color=#5bd285]Mei: No problem.[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: I can't wait to break these knives in.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Katie: ...You alright?
Rise: oh come on, do you really think I'm gonna use them like that?[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: No, I'm just thinking that sentence had unfortunate implications, that's all.[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: whatever.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-618.png[/img]

You sit back and vaguely watch the group open their presents.

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#00ff00]Hazel: ...What[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...alchemy is a trip sometimes.[/color]
[color=#00ff00]Hazel: ...Clearly.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: I tried to make the worst sonic game. I believe I succeeded.[/color]
[color=#00ff00]Hazel: I think the GBA port of Sonic 1 might still be worse[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...this probably actually existed in a parallel universe somewhere.[/color]
[color=#c8a8cd]Nick: yikes...[/color]
[color=#00ff00]Hazel: So uhhhh, what do I do with this[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...Honestly I was gonna give it to someone else that had prepared a white elephant gift, but nobody did.[/color]
[color=#c8a8cd]Nick: maybe stick it in a collector's case somewhere?[/color]
[color=#00ff00]Hazel: ...I can offer you a doomba?[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...god maybe we should just... try and play it, sometime.[/color]
[color=#00ff00]Hazel: ... You first pal[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...the start of the game has a quick time event that... I can't beat.[/color]
[color=#00ff00]Hazel: H.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-619.gif[/img]

After being given a crowbar, you begin to go to town on that large crate.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-620.gif[/img] It hardly takes any time at all for the crate to be destroyed. There's a great number of unknown and interesting ingots here!
[color=#c8a8cd]Nick: whoa[/color] [color=#ff0000]Rise: holy shit[/color] [color=#0000ff]June: wow, that's quite the gift you got there.[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-621.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#ff0000]Katie: Use a magnet on that one, it reduces the weight for some reason.[/color]
[color=#a58a40]Coleman: woah.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...I question how this works, but that is kinda the point.[/color]
[color=#0000ff]June: ...i just realized, i'm a few days in the future. i better get back soon.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...oops?[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Katie: Whoops[/color]
[color=#0000ff]June: *shrug*[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...probably should have Katie or Rise bring you back to be safe.[/color]
[color=#0000ff]June: i think i can probably jump to the right spot. probably.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-622.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#0080ff]Charles: ...oh, bring a few of these, just in case.[/color]
[color=#0000ff]June: uh, thanks?
June: what do i do with these?[/color]

[color=#0000ff]June: wow, this is, a lot of stuff. thank you.[/color][/spoiler]

p.b:
[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-623.gif[/img]
[color=#0000ff]June: well, i'll seeya another time.[/color]
[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-624.gif[/img]
[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-625.gif[/img]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-626.gif[/img]

This does not look like Charcherry.
[u]What will you do?[/u]

p.c: Run around wildly and smack into the fire hydrant
p.b:
[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-627.gif[/img]

This is not helping!

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-628.png[/img]

It's a red fire hydrant. Nothing particularly special about it. 
It's certainly as solid as any other fire hydrant you've ever ran into.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-630.png[/img]

You examine your surroundings. You appear to be in a city of some sort, though much of the objects seem to be scaled for those that are ever so slightly taller than you. You think you saw some tall bird people a moment ago? Perhaps they live in this city?

One thing for sure is that you are incredibly off-track here, and you don't have the stamina to go through yet another demanding quest.

p.c: June: Look for somewhere to stash the stargate?
p.b:
[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-631.png[/img]

You check your sylladex. You almost forgot about the stargate. If what Charles told you is true, you should be able to use this to get back to Charcherry.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-632.png[/img]

You begin walking.

p.c: Head outside the city and place it there! That's sure not to have any negative side effects, right?
p.b:
[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-633.png[/img]

Honestly you're too tired to walk that far.

p.c: look for somewhere that seems disused and secluded.
p.b:
[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-634.png[/img]

To avoid June from avoiding the italicized command out of spite, I've taken the liberty of skipping that one.
That staircase to the subway looking place seems to fit the description.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-635.png[/img]

You enter the underground train station. There is a subtle sense of weight and atrophy in the air.

[u]Would you like to save your progress?[/u]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-636.png[/img]

Huh, it looks like there's a save file already here.

p.c: June: Save in a new slot?
p.b:
[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-637.png[/img]

Probably a good idea. Never know when Thoren will need their save file.

p.c: June: Make two different save files, you know, just incase.
p.b:
[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-638.png[/img]

Perhaps a little redundant, but at least its safe.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-644.png[/img]

You continue onward, looking around a bit. That spot over there looks like a good place to put a stargate, you think. Just gotta move that traffic cone.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-645.png[/img]

There we go. Now you just need to put on this handy little watch, tell the thing to route to the preset destination, and wait for it to work, At least, you think that's how it works?

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-646.gif[/img]

You are now Thoren, and June is in grave danger.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-639.gif[/img]
[color=#0000ff]June: ...thoren?[/color] [color=#c20000]Thoren: GET OUT OF THE WAY![/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-640.png[/img]

What happens to you now does not matter, as long as June survives.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-641.png[/img]

You are now June, and you have just been saved from an unshielded stargate blast.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-642.png[/img]
[color=#0000ff]June: ...[/color]
Thoren has been blasted to smithereens, gone without a trace. You can only hope that was a doomed Thoren from a timeline where you didn't survive.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-643.png[/img]

You face the stargate. This one doesn't have a display on it, just a blue liquid-y looking portal.
You can only hope that it leads to where it's supposed to go.
[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-647.gif[/img]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-648.png[/img]

You arrive in Charcherry forest, near the lakeside path, very close to Purity Caldera.
It's nice to be back on Starter Planet again.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-649.png[/img]

And away you go!

(You briefly considered looking at or even stealing some traffic cones, but you really wanted to get moving a lot more)

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-650.gif[/img]

You fly to Thoren's house, on top of Mt. Phoenix.
You're not sure if it's home exactly, but it's the closest thing you've got for now.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-651.gif[/img] You enter the house and you are greeted by... another you???
[color=#0000ff]June: ?!?! Other June: oh yeah, this is the part where i showed up slightly in the future. Other June: just talk to thoren and they'll send you to the right time.[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-652.gif[/img]
[color=#0000ff]Other June: don't worry if this doesn't make sense, just go with it. [/color]

p.c: Probably not the best idea to save right now. Head over to Thoren.
p.b:
[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-653.png[/img]

You walk over towards Thoren. You're feeling a bit uneasy, especially with the whole incident of watching Thoren push you out of the path of a vaporizing beam.

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#c20000]Thoren: Hello June. Do you require anything?[/color]
[color=#0000ff]June: thoren! i am so glad to see you right now. i thought you were vaporized by the stargate?[/color]
[color=#c20000]Thoren: ...Vaporized? I had a nightmare of such a thing recently. 
Thoren: I suppose you only said so today to preserve the surprise on this day.[/color]
[color=#0000ff]June: oh, about that...
June: i need get back the past. i tried to zap to the right time but it just sent me somewhere else and a day later.[/color]
[color=#c20000]Thoren: Of course. Hold my hand and I shall send you to your native time.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-654.png[/img]

Holding onto Thoren's hand, you feel them surrounding you with temporal energy!
[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-655.gif[/img]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-657.png[/img]

Home.
You never thought you'd make it back here, in your rightful time and place.
Maybe not exactly the place you belong, but its the closest thing you have this month.

One thing for sure, you are absolutely exhausted from your ridiculous canon-spanning journey.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/afterretcon/lb3-656.png[/img]

Not wanting to climb up the stairs, you crash on the couch. 

You've had a long night and it's high time you get some shut-eye.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-658.png[/img] It's the dawn of a new day, and I managed to remember something.
[color=#c8a8cd]LS: I think I remember River telling me about the anniversary of the Vast Meep. I can't remember if that's today or tomorrow though.[/color] [color=#0080ff]FL: ...one moment.[/color]

p.c: Charles: any% speedrun back to the medium
p.b:
[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-659.gif[/img]

Not only that, but you seem to have remembered something too.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-660.png[/img]

How in the heck are you so freaking fast???

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-661.png[/img]
[color=#0080ff]FL: PCHOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-662.gif[/img]

You are now incredibly high above Starter Planet. The Door should be orbiting somewhere around here...

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-663.png[/img]
[size=7]refurbished platform base assembled by [url=https://mspfa.com/user/?u=116172542861964433598]Slate[/url][/size]

...There it is.
This should lead you back to the medium.
[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-664.png[/img]
[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-665.png[/img]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-666.png[/img]

And with that, you have successfully returned to The Medium, and in record time!
Now, where would you most likely be able to find a particular player...

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-667.png[/img]

It takes a bit of work getting used to the navigation again, but eventually you manage to locate the fabled Land of Ink and Roses.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-668.gif[/img]

There it is, the LoIaR HQ...

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-669.png[/img]

Seven years of no visiting players and no maintenance must have done a number to the place.

[spoiler open="Show Memolog" close="Hide Memolog"][color=#c8a8cd]LS: what's going on?[/color]
[color=#d5aa00]SF: I baked too many cookies that my power had to be contained. Too small to bake anymore.
SF: This is disappointing.[/color]
[color=#c8a8cd]LS: aw[/color][/spoiler]

p.c: holy crap that is a lot of planets
p.b:
[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-670.png[/img]

Yeah... The SBARGv2 session had like, 100 players in it at very least. One of those mmo style sessions where a ton of homestuck nerds just sorta tried to cram into the same session at the same time to escape The Reckoning. A lot of the players died during the session proper, only leaving like, 50 to claim the Ultimate Reward.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-671.png[/img] You feel like you're being judged or watched, but try to ignore it. ...does this have something to do with the fate of the player that once lived here? The Witch of Life that died during the fire that gave Charcherry its name?
[color=#ff0000]PK: Did you stop shrinking?[/color] [color=#0080ff]FL: is that what miss M told you, Brae? FL: ...not using her name, might draw too much attention.[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-672.png[/img]

If anyone's going to be around here, they would be here, in the "goat bar", as you call it sometimes.
Really, it's just a cafeteria lounge area named after a particularly important hex color.

Unfortunately, you cannot see or sense River here. 

[spoiler open="Show Memolog" close="Hide Memolog"][color=#0080ff]FL: also I went looking for River, they aren't in the HQ on LoIaR. 
FL: Also I swear someone is staring at me, judging me, that I shouldn't be here.[/color]
[color=#d5aa00]SF: I've stopped shrinking, yes. Mab said it's my own fault for shrinking though, but didn't say exactly how.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]FL: ...maybe you have a fixed amount of energy generating your body, and baking all those cookies drained most of it?[/color]
[color=#d5aa00]SF: I don't know if that's what it is either.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-673.gif[/img]

You are now Blaze, on an entirely different land. Checking on your phone (which refuses to render on the visible spectrum most of the time at this point), you notice that someone is completely lost. You attempt to send something. 

[spoiler open="Show Memolog" close="Hide Memolog"]-- [color=#ad6625]onewhoisneverNear[/color] [[color=#ad6625]ON[/color]] uploaded a corrupted file titled lohan-village-coordinates.frgps --
[color=#0080ff]FL: ...contents of the file are borked, but... lohan is only so big.
FL: assuming that land of holes and  numbers, and not another land.[/color]
[color=#ad6625]ON: [/color][alt=Note: the meaning of the blue checkmark has aged like milk. Back in 2020 it still meant something.][img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/bluecheckmark.png[/img][/alt][/spoiler]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-676.png[/img]

You are now Katie, and you've arrived to Brae's cabin to deliver a growth potion.

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#ff0000]Katie: Hey Brae. Do you have a straw?[/color]
[color=#d5aa00]Brae: I don't think I have any straws...
Brae: I hope it works though.[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Katie: I believe that... Half of the potion should be enough to get you back to your original height. 
Katie: If you drink too much you'll get taller than you originally were so don't overdo it.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-677.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#d5aa00]Brae: How long does it usually take for the effects to happen?[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Katie: Usually about 15 minutes for humans, might be a bit faster or slower on your physiology though.[/color]
[color=#d5aa00]Brae: Do you have like, a plastic bottle cap? I could use it as a cup, because I don't have a straw...[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Katie: Would you like me to pour it for you?[/color]
[color=#d5aa00]Brae: Yes, please.[/color][/spoiler]

p.c: Katie: pour Brae a few caps of potion
p.b:
[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-678.png[/img]

You fill the cap for her, as many times as needed. 
You hope that this potion works...

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-674.png[/img] You are now River. You just got up a little while ago and now you are having lunch. You never leave home without a table, whether it be for table kicking or for actually using to set things down upon. You've been noticing somebody flying overhead. Is that... Charles? You decide to pester them just in case.
-- [color=#c8a8cd]shinyJiggly[/color] [[color=#c8a8cd]SJ[/color]] is pestering [color=#0080ff]frozenLake[/color] [[color=#0080ff]FL[/color]] -- [color=#c8a8cd]SJ: hey, what are you doing up there?[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-675.png[/img]

You land after finally spotting River. It looks like that incredibly glitched player they've been traveling with is also in the area, but far away enough to avoid corrupting anything within reach.

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#0080ff]Charles: I was looking for you! There's only... two ish days until christmas![/color]
[color=#c8a8cd]River: Uh, is that it?
River: is there like, a timeloop I'm needed for or something?[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...I just figured you would want to be there with everyone?[/color]
[color=#c8a8cd]River: I dunno, I've sorta drifted from the group over the years. y'all have your own things going on and all. 
River: Besides, who's gonna keep Blaze company on christmas if I abandon her to visit you guys? 
River: That doesn't seem right, especially considering she's barred from entering Gene due to glitches.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...[/color]
[color=#c8a8cd]River: you know, if you really missed me, you could just tell it to me straight-up instead of going through elaborate plans.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...how close is Blaze to being done with their quest?[/color]
[color=#ad6625][font=Arial]BÌ´ÌÍlÌµÌÍaÌ¶ÌÌ¿zÌ´ÍÌ¾eÌ¶ÌÍ:[/font][/color] ðð
[color=#c8a8cd]River: uh.... It's probably gonna take a while. it's a big session and there's lots of glitches out there.[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...right. well, I guess that makes that idea a moot point... I might be able to rig up something with a remote soul bot, but... I don't know how long that would last, and... having Blaze be able to spend time in gene... before being yanked back... that just seems cruel.[/color]
[color=#ad6625][font=Arial]BÌ´ÌÍlÌµÌÍaÌ¶ÌÌ¿zÌ´ÍÌ¾eÌ¶ÌÍ: *shrug*[/font][/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...is there anything you would like me to get you two, from Gene?[/color]
[color=#c8a8cd]River: hmm... not sure. maybe some baked goods?[/color]
[color=#ad6625][font=Arial]BÌ´ÌÍlÌµÌÍaÌ¶ÌÌ¿zÌ´ÍÌ¾eÌ¶ÌÍ: AÌ´ Ì·mÌ·oÌ·rÌ¶eÌ´ ÌµgÌµlÌ¸iÌ¸tÌ·cÌ·hÌ´ ÌµrÌ¸eÌ¶sÌµiÌ¸sÌµtÌ¸aÌµnÌ´tÌ´ Ì´cÌ¶oÌ·mÌ¸pÌ·uÌ¸tÌµiÌ¶nÌ´gÌ· Ì¸dÌ¸eÌ´vÌ´iÌµcÌ´eÌ¶ Ì·wÌ¸oÌ¶uÌµlÌ´dÌµ Ì·bÌ¶eÌµ Ì¶aÌ´pÌµpÌ´rÌ¶eÌµcÌ¸iÌ·aÌµtÌ´eÌ¶dÌ¸.Ì·[/font][/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: hmm...
Charles: ...you tried hard light interfaces?[/color]
[color=#ad6625][font=Arial]BÌ´ÌÍlÌµÌÍaÌ¶ÌÌ¿zÌ´ÍÌ¾eÌ¶ÌÍ: ð¤[/font][/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...okay, where is the closest alchemiter...[/color]
[color=#c8a8cd]River: I got one back at the house. It's a bit of a flight back there though.[/color]
[/spoiler]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-679.gif[/img]

Hopefully this might work?

p.c: Charles: attempt to use this alchemiter
p.b:
[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-680.gif[/img]

WORK ALREADY, FROGDAMMIT!

...yeah no, this isn't gonna work. You're best off taking the trip to River's dwelling spire a distance away.
[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-681.png[/img]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-682.png[/img]

Here it is: River's house.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-683.png[/img]

This thing is a sight for sore eyes for me. I used to have the same house pre-entry. 
I suppose it only makes sense, considering me and River used to be basically the same person before a certain divergence point before the game.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-684.png[/img]

You enter Rivers's house. Fortunately the door was unlocked, so entry was relatively trivial.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-685.png[/img]

You manage to spot the alchemiter right away. Fortunately its a pretty well upgraded one.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-686.png[/img]

You type in the code for a lunchtop and it alchemizes perfectly.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-687.png[/img]

You are now Brae, and the potion is doing absolutely jack shit in terms of magical effects. 
This is troubling.

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#ff0000]Katie: Hmm. It should be working?
Rise: hey everyone.[/color]
[color=#a58a40]Coleman: hey Rise.[/color]
[color=#d5aa00]Brae: What were you doing that got you so beat up, Rise?[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: fighting underlings for grist. Thoren needed some sburb equipment. I'll heal up eventually.[/color]
[color=#a58a40]Coleman: Rise do you want to borrow my healing sword?[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: thanks for the offer, but I'm fine.[/color]
[color=#a58a40]Coleman: alright thought i would offer.
Coleman: hey Katie I have my gift for the secret santa event ready. Do you want me to give it to you so you can let CAFai hold it until Friday? 
Coleman: though if CAFai tells me what room they are being stored in i guess i could just teleport it there.[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Katie: I can take it Coleman.[/color]
[color=#a58a40]Coleman: alright i'll get it set up to send with you then.[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Katie: ...Do you feel any magic from the potion, Brae?[/color]
[color=#d5aa00]Brae: No. I just feel really bloated from drinking that much.[/color]
[color=#a58a40]Coleman: it could be that the difference in her Fae nature could just different enough to make the potion ineffective.[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Katie: They generally work for most alien races... But I'm not sure how different fae physiology is from less magical life?
Rise: There's gotta be some reason...
Katie: Are all fairies this size?[/color]
[color=#a58a40]Coleman: No. they come in difference sizes sometimes based on they relative strength but not always.[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Katie: Huh... Well I'm sorry it didn't work. Maybe there's a spell on her overriding it or something?[/color]
[color=#a58a40]Coleman: Brae did your talk with the Queen of Air and Darkness make it seem like that might be the case?[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: should I go alchemize some smaller clothes?[/color]
[color=#d5aa00]Brae: Smaller clothes would be good.[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Rise: I'll make sure you got enough to wear for a little while.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-688.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#a58a40]Coleman: Can you tell me her words exactly?[/color]
[color=#d5aa00]Brae: *sigh...*
Brae: She just told me that this is nobody's fault but my own. Didn't really elaborate. If I wanted to go back to my normal size, I would need to figure it out myself.[/color]
[color=#a58a40]Coleman: hmmmm. Well  that might take some thought but i might be able to come up with an answer of what it might be.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-689.png[/img]
[color=#ff0000]Katie: Well, I guess I should head home?[/color] [color=#a58a40]Coleman: if you want though give me one moment.[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-690.png[/img] You wait for an awkward moment while Coleman is getting something upstairs.
[color=#d5aa00]Brae: Ah, right. I have my present ready for the gift exchange too. It's the unlabeled one under the tree with the presents for Rise and Coleman.
[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-692.png[/img] You walk over to the (relocated!) tree and captchalogue the gift. As usual, the wrapping paper color is obscured from view.
[color=#d5aa00]Brae: Thank you Katie. And... thank you for the potion too, even if it didn't work.[/color] [color=#ff0000]Katie: No problem Brae, hopefully you can figure out what's going soon.[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-691.png[/img]

You arrive back downstairs and hand off the mystery gift to Katie.

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"][color=#a58a40]Coleman: hopefully Thoren doesn't mind you helping us out with this a bit.[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Katie: Thoren's got enough on their plate [/color]
[color=#a58a40]Coleman: Fair enough.
Coleman: I hope whoever gets it like it.[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Katie: ...You did label it for the person you were given, right?[/color]
[color=#a58a40]Coleman: Of course.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-693.png[/img] With your work done here, you make your way to the door.
[color=#ff0000]Katie: Well, I guess I'll be off then. Good luck fixing the smol disease.[/color] [color=#d5aa00]Brae: ð[/color] [color=#a58a40]Coleman: later Katie.[/color]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-694.png[/img] After a lengthy flight, you finally arrive back at the lunch table with the lunchtop. You can only hope that this works.
[color=#c8a8cd]River: that was pretty quick.[/color]

[flash=650x450]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/left%20beef/blazelunchtop.swf[/flash]
[size=7]A direct edit of [url=https://www.homestuck.com/story/825]this flash animation[/url][/size]

It's a miracle! It works!

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-695.gif[/img]

You immediately decide to install retroarch and play some mario 64. 
Meanwhile, River and Charles talk a bit.

[spoiler open="Show Dialoglog" close="Hide Dialoglog"]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...sorry I don't have baked goods for you right now... I tend to stock up on replicator food, and I admit... not everyone likes that.[/color]
[color=#c8a8cd]River: well, it was worth a shot.
River: like, I can bake on my own, but it's not quite as satisfying, you know?[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: Maybe you could ask Brae? I mean, she did make a ton of cookies...[/color]
[color=#c8a8cd]River: Oh yeah, she sent those cookies that time I think? Or at least I read about it a while ago?[/color]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...yeah. you can still hop on the memo, right? If you need anything, don't hesitate to ask, alright?[/color]
[color=#c8a8cd]River: yeah, of course. I just don't really need that much since I'm pretty much self-sufficient.[/color][/spoiler]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-696.png[/img]
[color=#0080ff]Charles: ...I'll just head, then. Take care of yourself, River.[/color] [color=#c8a8cd]River: alright, seeya Charles.[/color] [color=#ad6625]Blaze: ð ^-^[/color]

LS: if anything, River could probably print out paper copies or something[/color] [color=#ad6625]ON: It's a shame my flower died, it made my Quest somewhat manageable.[/color] [color=#c8a8cd]LS: :c[/color] [color=#ad6625]ON: (My Quest involves purging all the glitches from SBARGv2's Incipisphere.)[/color] [color=#c8a8cd]LS: dang, good luck with that LS: SBARGv2 is supposed to be like, legendarily glitched among completed sessions[/color] [color=#ad6625]ON: Yes, I believe that is why I was put on this task. ON: It'd be easier if I could get access to the Grid, but they rightfully don't let me anywhere close.[/color] [/spoiler]

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-697.gif[/img]

You are now Thoren, and you're getting quite a bit out of this new alchemiter setup! You should be able to make your gift quota in an hour. 

Why didn't you think of this any sooner?

p.c: The gifts don't need to be individualized.... right?
p.b:
[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-698.png[/img]

It may not look like it on the outside, but all of these gifts have been personalized. 

You made sure to write up a rather lengthy batch process that would alchemize all of the listed items, with the same packaging surrounding all of them. That makes it easier to factor into the captchalogue code logic, after all.

[img]https://file.garden/YJ4GVaMz-xKjrPWz/nonepizza/missioncomplete/lb3-699.png[/img] You are now Charles. You glance at the factory chugging away. Neat.
